title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Job Description**
* onboarding services, designing and developing features, custom plugins and integrations with 3rd party systems
* maintaining installation stable, secure, efficient, and up-to-date
* collaborating with stakeholders, including developers, architects, and infrastructure teams, to understand requirements, gather feedback, continuously improve Backstage, and support them in their onboarding and plugin development
* making code quality improvements


**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* Experience with the development of modern, cloud-based, containerized solutions
* Strong JavaScript skills coupled with experience in React and Node.js
* Experienced with relational databases, RESTful APIs, GitHub
* Senior behavior, demonstrating leadership and empowerment towards peers, and strategic thinking about technology
* Comfortable in facilitating and participating in the team discussions and problem solving


**Meritorious**
* Experience with: Docker, Kubernetes, monitoring tools like Grafana or Splunk
* Proficiency in making code quality improvements and ensuring high standards in all development processes
* Collaborating with stakeholders, including developers, architects, and infrastructure teams, to understand requirements, gather feedback, and continuously improve the platform
* Familiarity with Azure DevOps, YAML, Kubernetes, GraphQL, Terraform, automated code analysis tools
* Capability to support onboarding services and plugin development


**Application deadline:** 
 10-02-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Engineer to Mynewsdesk
description:
This is a tricky ad because
 **your title could be anything** 
 : Data Engineer, Fullstack Developer, Analytics Engineer, Software Engineer, Platform Engineer—the list goes on!
   

  

 Whatever your title, if you’re passionate about
 **driving change, solving complex challenges** 
 , and being at the
 **center of innovation** 
 , we want to hear from you.
   

  

 Join Mynewsdesk’s CRM & Operations team, a group that thrives on automation, collaboration, and challenging the status quo. We’re looking for someone ready to hands on work with our systems and processes—particularly our self-hosted Data Warehouse—while contributing across our broad technical landscape.
   

  

**Our Mission**
 Our team sits at the heart of Mynewsdesk, automating and transforming how the company operates in our business systems. We deliver smart solutions that simplify workflows, connect systems, and empower departments to excel. So far we’ve automated the provisioning of our subscriptions, launched new agreement solutions, and most recently we have built a Data Warehouse, all self hosted in open-source platforms.
   

  

**Where We’re Going**
 We’re just getting started!
   

  

* We’ve established our first core metrics, and the next steps include enriching data with product usage insights, financial metrics, and leveraging AI for internal efficiency.
* We’re exploring opportunities to push boundaries, challenge how we’ve worked before, and adopt new tools and techniques to solve real business challenges.
* Example of what could be up next, further enrichment of our Data Warehouse, drive efficiency via new integrations and enhance our subscription management.


 To take this to the next level, we need someone who shares our vision and thrives in breaking new ground.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
 As part of our team, you’ll have the opportunity to:
   

  

* Lead the Data Warehouse Evolution: Optimize and expand our self-hosted data systems to meet growing business needs.
* Integrate and Automate: Enhance integrations between key business systems, driving automation and efficiency.
* Collaborate Broadly: Work alongside CRM Admins, commercial and financial teams, developers, and product teams to design impactful solutions.
* Explore and Innovate: Challenge existing processes, adopt new techniques, and find creative ways to leverage AI and automation.


**Who You Are**
 We’re looking for someone versatile, curious, and driven. You thrive on solving challenges, learning new skills, and contributing across various areas of expertise.
   

  

**You’ll Excel If You Have**
* At least 5 years of experience in a similar role.
* A strong foundation in working with data systems, particularly self-hosted or open-source solutions.
* Experience with integrations and automation between business systems.
* An interest in exploring AI and new technologies to drive meaningful change.
* The ability to collaborate with both technical and non-technical teams.
* Proficiency in DBT, SQL, and at least one additional programming language.


**Apply now and let’s grow together! 🌟**
 We have fun, we are challengers, and we provide a market-leading PR platform.
   

  

 Answer the questions in the application process and preferably apply with your LinkedIn profile. No CV or cover letter is required.
   

  

 Questions? Contact Head of CRM & Operations robert.kjellqvist@mynewsdesk.com or
   

  

 Talent Acquisition Manager linda.stuve@mynewsdesk.com
   

  

 Mynewsdesk is a true pioneer, providing communicators with a modern digital PR service. With just one click, you can give the right audiences direct access to relevant press releases, blog posts, social media feeds, high-resolution images and graphics, videos, and more – at the right time. Influencers can start following your newsroom, engage with content, and become part of a network of influencers.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Welcome to SSC – Swedish Space Corporation, the perfect workplace for those passionate about technology in general and space in particular.
   

  

 With space organizations, research institutes, institutional and commercial actors as customers, we offer specialist expertise in satellite communications, space consulting
   

  

 services, rocket and balloon systems, flight test services, satellite propulsion systems, and much more.
   

  

 At SSC, we provide our customers access to Space. With over 700 employees around the world, we provide expert-level competence in customer support including the design,
   

  

 test, launch, in-orbit and routine operations of flight and space systems. To achieve this, SSC uses our global network of ground systems and multi-mission antennas to provide
   

  

 satellite management, data downlink, antenna hosting and launch support to some of the largest names in the space industry including NASA, ESA, JAXA and many other New
   

  

 Space customers as well.
   

  

**Are you fueled by a passion for people and the ambition to create an awesome workplace?
   

  

 Are you ready to embark on an exciting journey with us to help Earth benefit from space?** 
  

  

 If you answer yes to these questions, we invite you to seize the opportunity to make a significant impact as a Software Engineer in our team. We are looking for a dedicated team memberwho shares our core values of Customer passion, Care, Collaboration, Curiosity, and Courage.
   

  

**YOUR ROLE**
 We offer the opportunity to join the Software unit within SSC Connect, which is entrusted to develop and maintain critical systems required to connect our customers with their satellites.
   

  

 This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a team that is building a new Monitoring & Control system. With a new system comes challenges beyond the code. Together with your colleagues, you will set the standard for how we build new systems, but also for how we handle a production environment in the cloud, how we enable efficient operations by enhanced observability and most importantly how we create a great user experience for our customers. What this team builds up, many other teams will use.
   

  

 It is important for us to have a good balance of experience in all teams, so currently we are looking for both a senior software engineer and a software engineer that is earlier in their development.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 We think that you care – about your systems, your colleagues and your users. That you have a creative and analytical mindset. You take responsibility, drive your own initiatives and can learn and process technical details quickly. We also think that you appreciate both working autonomously and together with other people.
   

  

 You have a European citizenship and can travel within and outside Sweden if needed. As this position is critical to the operations of the SSC Services, it may include outside of standard working hours working and/or being part of an on-call team with up to 1 week on-call per month.
   

  

**What You Need To Know**
* B.S. Computer Science or Computer/Software Engineering, or similar experience
* 2+ years of software development experience (considerably longer if you aspire on the senior software engineer position)
* Experience with Golang and Python or similar languages
* Comfortable working in Linux
* Fluency in English


**EXTRA MERITS**
* Familiar with AWS
* Experience with message bus technologies like NATS/Kafka
* Experience of API development using RESTFul(JSON/XML)
* Experience of DevOps and CI/CD Methodologies
* Experience from the space industry


**WE OFFER YOU**
* An opportunity to be part of the exciting space industry and help Earth benefit from Space.
* An excellent opportunity for personal development and challenging endeavors.
* To be part of international development projects with highly engaged teams.
* A workplace characterized by an open atmosphere and proud employees all over the world.
* Possibility to work remotely part of the time (max 50%), and flexible work hours.


**LOCATION**
 This is permanent position with 40 hours/week, located at our office in Solna or Kiruna.
   

  

**NEXT STEP**
 If this opportunity sparks your interest, don’t wait—apply today! Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis, and interviews will be conducted continuously. We kindly ask you to submit your CV when applying. While you are welcome to include a brief personal note or letter, our evaluation will primarily focus on your skills and qualifications as outlined in your CV, ensuring a fair and unbiased recruitment process.
   

  

 Please note that the job advertisement may close earlier than the stated deadline if we receive a high volume of applications. This allows us to ensure a fair and efficient recruitment process and give each application the attention it deserves.
   

  

 This is a security-classified position and will require a background check prior to employment.
   

  

**WE HELP EARTH BENEFIT FROM SPACE**
 Swedish Space Corporation (SSC) is a leading global provider of advanced space services, with more than 50 years of experience. We help space organizations, research institutes, commercial and institutional actors from all over the world to get access to space.
   

  

 With local presence on all continents and about 700 committed employees, we offer specialist expertise in satellite communications and satellite control services, spacecraft operations, rocket and balloon systems, launch services and flight test services, as well as engineering, operations and consultancy services for space missions.
   

  

 We help Earth benefit from Space.

title: Solution Architect
description:
We are looking for a highly talented solution architect that has great experience working with different software technologies and the ability to translate business requirements into sustainable technical solutions and keep a holistic view.
   

  

 Good knowledge in the development processes, tools and other technology such as databases, frameworks, third-party products.
   

  

 Good communication skills to be able to discuss issues and justify the choice of solution, both with technical specialists and people without technical knowledge.
   

  

 Meritorious but not necessary: Java, Docker, Git, Microservices, CI/CD, Relational databases, and Certifications in AWS Cloud is a major plus
   

  

 The Role
   

  

 You will be expected to shape and translate Business and IT strategy and needs into realizable, sustainable technology solutions. You will provide insight, thought leadership, and innovation to ensure that the solution meets the nordic choice’s business goals. You will ensure that the solution is designed for production and can be delivered efficiently while making sure that the solution has integrity (is safe, secure, and compliant). You will be responsible for creating technical solution descriptions (High-Level Design and Detailed Design documentation) through collaboration with the customer team and colleagues.
   

  

 Your profile
   

  

 As a Solution Architect, we expect you to have a broad technical understanding, developer background, and strong communication skills with the ability to guide and advise our clients. You have an agile mindset; are quick to adapt to challenges and learn from new experiences.
   

  

**Skills Required**
* You have experience working as Architect, including being responsible for the end product
* Solution Architecture Document (SAD) or similar
* Previous design development experience using technologies such as .Net, C#, Web API or Java, J2EE
* Experience in defining Integration Roadmaps & Architecture and/or working with cloud solutions (Azure, AWS or GCP, etc.)
* Knowledge of different industry best practices in API, integration & Microservices
* Familiar with agile ways of working and DevOps
* You have a higher diploma (e.g. Bachelor or Masters degree) or equal
* You are fluent in either Swedish or English


 This role is based in
 **Stockholm** 
 . Fluency in English is required for this position, however Swedish is not needed.
   

  

 Sounds interesting?
   

  

 Great, because we would love to get to know you too! Submit your application below and let us tell you more! Interviews will be held on a rolling basis so don’t wait with your application.

title: Java Developer (R-17335)
description:
**Why We Work at Dun & Bradstreet**
 Dun & Bradstreet combines global data and local expertise to help clients make smarter decisions. With 6,000+ people in 31 countries, we are a team of diverse thinkers and problem solvers who all share a common curiosity: to find new ways to turn data into value. If you share this curiosity and want to be part of a future-ready company, come join us! Learn more at dnb.com/careers .
   

  

**The role**
 We are looking for an experienced Java Developer to join our team in Sweden. We maintain and develop several business-critical applications built on Java, .NET, and SQL Server. As we move toward a unified, modern architecture in Java and AWS, we need a help to drive technical improvements, support the team, and promote best practices in software development and agile collaboration.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Hands-On Development: Design, build, and refactor systems into containerized microservices running in cloud.
* Handle critical maintenance & support in both modern and legacy: Handle incidents in production systems with technical investigations and solutions.
* Drive Modernization: Contribute to the strategy and execution of transforming legacy applications into modern cloud solutions.
* Support the Team: Share knowledge, promote modern software development practices, and encourage team collaboration.
* Advocate for Best Practices: Implement clean code principles, CI/CD pipelines, and containerization (Docker).


**Skills**
* Technical Expertise:
* Around 5 years of experience with Java and microservices development.
* Exposure to legacy systems (e.g., .NET and relational databases like SQL Server, Postgres, MongoDB).
* Proficiency with Docker and experience building containerized applications.
* Familiarity with Spring Boot framework and AWS cloud services.
* Well-oriented and comfortable working on Linux on-prem servers.
* Team and Collaboration:
* Ability to work effectively in a team environment, sharing knowledge and supporting colleagues.
* Experience working with agile processes and a collaborative mindset.
* Mindset:
* Passion for system modernization, solving technical challenges and improving processes.
* Willingness to bridge the gap between legacy systems and modern software solutions.
* Fluent in both English and Swedish language


**Why Join Us?**
**Benefits**
 Does this role sound like a great opportunity but you’re not sure about making a move? We are really proud of our company and culture and think we have some great things to offer. Some of our benefits in Sweden include:
   

  

* Two paid volunteer days to contribute to causes in your community
* A paid day every year to use for your health and wellness
* Instead of half days before public holidays, you will have 4 additional full days a year for you to use to celebrate what is meaningful to you
* Annual wellness/sport benefit
* Collective agreement, pension, insurance and parental pay allowance
* Access to free services providing support and counselling
* Flexible working arrangements and hybrid work arrangement for most roles


**New Office Location**
 Our office is currently located in Solna, however we are very excited to be moving to a beautiful new location in central Stockholm at the end of 2025. Our future address will be Fleminggatan 14 in Kungsholmen, just a short walk from Stockholm Central Station.
   

  

***Whilst some roles do have certain requirements which are essential, we try to focus on hiring based on potential rather than CV as much as possible. If you are unsure you fully meet the requirements, we would still love to hear from you!***
 All Dun & Bradstreet job postings can be found at https://www.dnb.com/about-us/careers-and-people/joblistings.html and https://jobs.lever.co/dnb . Official communication from Dun & Bradstreet will come from an email address ending in @dnb.com.
   

  

 Notice to Applicants : Please be advised that this job posting page is hosted and powered by Lever. Your use of this page is subject to Lever's Privacy Notice and Cookie Policy , which governs the processing of visitor data on this platform.

title: Microsoft Power Platform Developer
description:
**Power Platform Developer** 




  





**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
 



**Language:** 
 Swedish
 



**Duration:** 
 6-month contract + Extension
 



  





**About the Company:** 




 Our client is a leading financial institution based in Stockholm, with a strong presence across the Nordic and Baltic regions. They are committed to innovation and digital transformation, leveraging cutting-edge technologies to enhance business operations and customer experience.
 



  





**About the Role:** 




 We are seeking a skilled Power Platform Developer to play a key role in designing and implementing automation and AI-driven solutions. This role will focus on Power Automate, Copilot Studio, and M365 Copilot integration within a highly regulated environment.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Lead the design and implementation of Power Platform solutions, ensuring scalability and efficiency.
* Integrate M365 Copilot into enterprise environments while maintaining compliance with industry regulations.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to analyse business processes and identify automation and AI opportunities.
* Develop strategy and governance models for Power Platform adoption in a regulated setting.

**Required Skills & Experience:**
