* Chat with our landlords to keep our space looking sharp and functioning well.
* Handle the ins and outs of daily office life, from parcels to perfecting our meeting spaces.
* Champion a tidy and welcoming space – think less clutter, more comfort.
* Roll out the red carpet for visitors, making them feel valued from the moment they arrive.


**What Makes You a Great Fit**
* You’re all about initiative and sorting things out before anyone even realizes there’s a thing to sort.
* Positivity is your middle name, and you’re all about helping others.
* You’ve got top-notch chat skills and love building relationships.
* You’re the king or queen of organization, with an eye for detail that nothing gets past.
* Tech doesn’t intimidate you; you’re comfortable with IT stuff and chatting with tech support.
* You have previous experience of working in an office environment or behind a front desk in hospitality.
* Based in Stockholm? Perfect, that’s where we need you!


 Excited to make our office your next success story? Shoot over your resume and a cover letter that tells us why you’re the one. We’re all about getting to know the real you and what makes you tick.
   

  

 Don’t wait around – we’re chatting with awesome folks like you as we speak.

title: Principal Customer Success Manager
description:
**Company Description**
 It all started in sunny San Diego, California in 2004 when a visionary engineer, Fred Luddy, saw the potential to transform how we work. Fast forward to today — ServiceNow stands as a global market leader, bringing innovative AI-enhanced technology to over 8,100 customers, including 85% of the Fortune 500®. Our intelligent cloud-based platform seamlessly connects people, systems, and processes to empower organizations to find smarter, faster, and better ways to work. But this is just the beginning of our journey. Join us as we pursue our purpose to make the world work better for everyone.
   

  

**Job Description**
**Are you a “transformation-maker”?**
 Do you enjoy driving transformation and setting up companies for a successful future? Do you have experience with transformation programs, consultancy, and being a trusted advisor? – Great! – Then join our outstanding Customer Success Team that enables our customers to utilize our innovative ServiceNow Platform most effectively. You will do this through a portfolio of standardized services, leading best practices, methodologies, and tools based on experiences from thousands of customer engagements. And of course by leveraging your vast experience in driving digital transformation.
   

  

**What You Get To Do In This Role**
 “If our customers are successful, we are successful!” This will be your mantra. You will bring it to life by delivering consultancy and services to F500 companies up to the CxO level. You are building relationships across customers and partners and acting as a trusted advisor in many different areas like Vision & Strategy, Roadmap Development, Partner Management, Implementation Strategy, Value Management, Governance, and Product Adoption – just to name a few. There’s plenty of standardized ServiceNow best-practice material available so you can respond to the customer’s needs. In that fashion, you will be working with 1-3 customers, organizing your work yourself. This is one side of the medal.
   

  

 On the other side, you are orchestrating the internal collaboration of the ServiceNow account team. Because you are not alone. Our philosophy that we live day in and day out is “Teamwork makes the Dream work"!
   

  

 The final objective is a successful, happy customer that will provide a high customer satisfaction rating based on the achievement of tangible value derived from their digital transformation.
   

  

**Qualifications**
**Can you be successful?**
 We all enjoy our work if we can achieve and celebrate successes – internally and of course for our customers. While we provide you with a comprehensive onboarding journey when you start in this role, you also need to come up with a set of relevant experiences and skills that we can build upon.
   

  

**To be successful in this role you have**
* A passion for working with customers
* 10+ years of progressive experience as part of a professional services organization; or equivalent education/experience
* Worked in advisory roles focused on technology (Digital/SaaS/Enterprise Software) enabled transformations
* Experience at F100-1000 accounts
* Depth in digital transformation design, implementation, and management
* Expertise in one industry, "minors" in one or two additional industries
* IT, HR, or GBS transformation experience
* Experience in establishing and maintaining executive relationships with CxO and business line leaders including managing expectations
* Identified business outcomes, and goals and have achieved them
* Experience in serving as part of a client account leadership team
* Developed account partnering (co-delivery) relationships with large consultancies and technology implantation firms
* Right to work in country


 Additional Information
   

  

**Work Personas**
 We approach our distributed world of work with flexibility and trust. Work personas (flexible, remote, or required in office) are categories that are assigned to ServiceNow employees depending on the nature of their work. Learn more here.
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 ServiceNow is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status, or any other category protected by law. In addition, all qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with legal requirements.
   

  

**Accommodations**
 We strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are unable to use this online application and need an alternative method to apply, please contact globaltalentss@servicenow.com for assistance.
   

  

**Export Control Regulations**
 For positions requiring access to controlled technology subject to export control regulations, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may be required to obtain export control approval from government authorities for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by relevant export control authorities.
   

  

 From Fortune. ©2024 Fortune Media IP Limited. All rights reserved. Used under license.

title: SAP Analytics Consultant
description:
**\*\*\* SAP Senior Analytics Consultant - 6-12 months + ext. - Hybrid \*\*\*** 




  





 On behalf of one of our clients RED now has a new opportunity for a Senior Analytics Consultant to join one of our leading customers.
 



  





 This contract is to start within 1 month, and hybrid work is required 2-3 days on site in Sweden.
 



  





**Specific skills/experience required:** 



* 5 - 10 years SAP Experience.
* Experience with SAP Analytics Cloud, BPC and DSP
* Able to join within 4 weeks
* Consultant has to be willing to travel on site to clients site in Sweden



  




* Please note: we do not provide any sponsorship for this position, the consultant has to be able to work in the EU without any sponsorship.



  





**If you are interested, please send your updated CV/ onoklebysognen@redglobal.com or apply on this advert.** 




  





 Looking forward to receiving your application

title: Product Owner
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Job Description**
* Drive and execute our SAP data analytics roadmap.
* Be the first point of contact for business owners and establish and maintain excellent relationships with key stakeholders.
* Manage platform’s business demand prioritization to ensure business continuity and support business excellence.
* Oversee platform’s technical and non-functional requirements, ensuring integrity, security, and sustainability of solutions and the platform.
* Take responsibility for the platform’s life cycle management and continuous optimization using best practices.
* Own the platform’s governance model and ensure guidelines are set and followed.
* Manage third-party vendors and technology partners.
* Stay up to date with modern technologies, exploring capabilities to meet evolving data requirements.
* Develop and deliver training sessions and workshops to educate users on SAP data and analytics applications.


**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* A proven track record in overseeing SAP data solutions in large-scale cross-functional environments, such as SAP BW on HANA, BW4/HANA, SAP Datasphere, SAP BPC, and SAP BO.
* Extensive experience with SAP modules, data models, authorization, data archiving, monitoring, and security requirements.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to manage ambiguous and crisis situations.
* Strong capability to translate abstract and technical subjects into clear business language.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Good experience with project management methodologies, change management processes, and tools.
* A solid understanding of Agile development and operations practices.


**Application deadline:** 
 10-02-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Cyber Security Konsult
description:
Position Description
   

  

 Är du en passionerad cybersäkerhetsexpert som brinner för att bekämpa de senaste hoten och jobba med de nyaste teknologierna? Vill du hjälpa företag att bli immuna mot cyberattacker? Då kan detta vara ditt nya jobb!
   

  

 Som cybersäkerhetskonsult hos oss kommer du få möjlighet att ta din säkerhetsexpertis till nästa nivå, genom att analysera, identifiera och hantera säkerhetsrisker för våra kunder. Du kommer också få möjlighet att delta i säkerhetsrevisioner, utveckla strategier och implementera lösningar för att stärka företags cybersäkerhet. Din expertis kommer att vara avgörande för att skapa en säker digital miljö och du får stor möjlighet att påverka vårt framtida tjänsteutbud inom området.
   

  

 Vi på CGI vet att säkerhet handlar om mer än bara teknik – det är en affärskritisk strategi som skyddar verksamheter och möjliggör innovation. Därför söker vi dig som vill vara med och bygga smarta, riskbaserade säkerhetslösningar som gör verklig nytta.
   

  

 ”Hos oss får du arbeta med engagerade kollegor, modern teknik och lösningar som stärker både organisationer och samhället. Om du delar vår passion för cybersäkerhet och vill vara en del av ett team som gör skillnad, så ser jag gärna att du ansöker.”
   

  

 Placering är på kontoret i Stockholm, Solna.
   

  

 Your future duties and responsibilities
   

  

**Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role**
**Together, as owners, let’s turn meaningful insights into action.**
 Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you’ll reach your full potential because…
   

  

 You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That’s why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company’s strategy and direction.
   

  

 Your work creates value. You’ll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.
   

  

 You’ll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You’ll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.
   

  

 Come join our team—one of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.
   

  

 Cyber Security Konsult
   

  

**Job Description**
 Är du en passionerad cybersäkerhetsexpert som brinner för att bekämpa de senaste hoten och jobba med de nyaste teknologierna? Vill du hjälpa företag att bli immuna mot cyberattacker? Då kan detta vara ditt nya jobb!
   

  

 Som cybersäkerhetskonsult hos oss kommer du få möjlighet att ta din säkerhetsexpertis till nästa nivå, genom att analysera, identifiera och hantera säkerhetsrisker för våra kunder. Du kommer också få möjlighet att delta i säkerhetsrevisioner, utveckla strategier och implementera lösningar för att stärka företags cybersäkerhet. Din expertis kommer att vara avgörande för att skapa en säker digital miljö och du får stor möjlighet att påverka vårt framtida tjänsteutbud inom området.
   

  

 Vi på CGI vet att säkerhet handlar om mer än bara teknik – det är en affärskritisk strategi som skyddar verksamheter och möjliggör innovation. Därför söker vi dig som vill vara med och bygga smarta, riskbaserade säkerhetslösningar som gör verklig nytta.
   

  

 ”Hos oss får du arbeta med engagerade kollegor, modern teknik och lösningar som stärker både organisationer och samhället. Om du delar vår passion för cybersäkerhet och vill vara en del av ett team som gör skillnad, så ser jag gärna att du ansöker.”
   

  

 Placering är på kontoret i Stockholm, Solna.
   

  

 Your future duties and responsibilities
   

  

* Genomföra säkerhetsanalyser och riskbedömningar.
* Designa och implementera säkerhetslösningar.
* Övervaka och hantera säkerhetsincidenter.
* Ge rådgivning och utbildning inom cybersäkerhet.
* Följa med i de senaste hoten och säkerhetstrenderna.


**Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role**
 I den här rekryteringen lägger vi stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper. För att trivas och bli framgångsrik i jobbet behöver du vara analytisk och gilla problemlösning. Du är bra på att kommunicera tekniska koncept på ett tydligt sätt till olika intressenter. Dessutom uppskattar du förändring och förbättring, och du håller dig alltid uppdaterad om det senaste inom cybersäkerhet.
   

  

* Vi tror att du har åtminstone ett par års arbetslivserfarenhet inom cybersäkerhet, IT-säkerhet
* Kompetens inom nätverkssäkerhet, penetrationstester och/eller incidenthantering.
* Förståelse för regulatoriska krav såsom NIS2, ISO 27001, GDPR mm.
* Relevant eftergymnasialutbildning


 Det är ett plus om du har någon/några av följande certifieringar ISC/GIAC/CISSP/CEH/CISM/CISA/ISO/IEC 27001/CCSP
   

  

 Vi erbjuder:
   

  

* En dynamisk och innovativ arbetsmiljö.
* Möjlighet att arbeta med ledande säkerhetsexperter.
* Utvecklingsmöjligheter och certifieringar inom cybersäkerhet.
* Konkurrenskraftig lön och förmåner.


 Är du redo att ta nästa steg i din karriär? Ansök nu och bli en del av vårt team!
   

  

 Vill du veta mer om jobbet är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande ledare Johan Lärksäter, johan.larksater@cgi.com
   

  

**Ensemble, en tant que propriétaires, mettons notre savoir-faire à l’œuvre.**
 La vie chez CGI est ancrée dans l’actionnariat, le travail d’équipe, le respect et un sentiment d’appartenance. Chez nous, vous pourrez exploiter votre plein potentiel parce que…
   

  

 Nous vous invitons à devenir propriétaire dès le jour 1 alors que nous travaillons ensemble à faire de notre rêve une réalité. C’est pourquoi nous nous désignons comme associés de CGI, plutôt que comme employés. Nous tirons profit des retombées de notre succès collectif et contribuons activement à l’orientation et à la stratégie de notre entreprise.
   

  

 Votre travail crée de la valeur. Vous élaborerez des solutions novatrices et développerez des relations durables avec vos collègues et clients, tout en ayant accès à des capacités mondiales pour concrétiser vos idées, saisir de nouvelles opportunités, et bénéficier d’une expertise sectorielle et technologique de pointe.
   

  

 Vous ferez évoluer votre carrière en vous joignant à une entreprise bâtie pour croître et durer. Vous serez soutenus par des leaders qui ont votre santé et bien-être à cœur et qui vous permettront de saisir des occasions afin de parfaire vos compétences et élargir les horizons.
   

  

 Joignez-vous à nous, l’une des plus importantes entreprises de conseil en technologie de l’information (TI) et en management au monde.

title: Head of Engineering
company_industry: Software Development, Marketing Services, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
**Large Company With Great Ambitions And Close Relations**
 efficy is a leading European Customer Relationship Management (CRM) solution that provides businesses of all sizes with complete, flexible, customizable, and scalable software to enable their growth. efficy’s platform includes products for marketing automation, sales, project management, customer service, and customer nurturing. Currently, more than 300,000 users from 63 countries use efficy’s tool.
   

  

 Founded in 2005 and headquartered in Brussels, efficy’s around 500 employees work in local offices in Belgium, France, Spain, the Netherlands, Sweden, Denmark, Finland, Norway, Warsaw, Hong Kong, or remotely.
   

  

 Our mission is to contribute to the success of every company by helping them transform customer data into customer insight while simplifying the work of their employees.
   

  

 In efficy, two days are rarely the same, and things are changing rapidly. So, fasten your seat belt, and join us on the journey.
   

  

**A Unique Work Experience & Company Culture**
 We want our employees to thrive in their daily lives, and therefore you can expect challenges, online music quizzes, onsite ping-pong tournaments, and lots more. Communication is informal, and your colleagues are only a short call away.
   

  

 Position Overview
   

  

 Reporting into the CTO, you will be responsible for the management, planning, and organisation of the R&D activities and team within a geographical area, specifically focused on the development of APSIS, one of efficy’s key product offerings.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities
   

  

* Manage and coordinate R&D teams and resources, including recruitment, performance evaluations, training and support, to ensure efficient and effective operations.
* Build a team of professionals, ensuring alignment between resource needs and availability.
* Have the ability to perform the roles of R&D architect and coordinator within the organization.
* Contribute to providing direction to the R&D department and follow up time slots, costs and resources linked to specific developments within the general lines of policy in consultation with the CTO to ensure that the organisation's goals can be realised.
* Take responsibility for drawing up and follow up the investment and development budget to ensure that sufficient resources are made available and that these are used in the best possible manner to achieve set objectives.
* Formulate and develop specific research programmes to ensure that you contribute towards the realisation of the R&D goals.
* Set the correct priorities and harmonise the planning of the different projects to be realised in the best possible manner based on other operations to ensure that an efficient and structured approach and execution of the different projects can be guaranteed.
* Coach and work on the development of your employees to ensure their competencies, skills and know-how are used and developed to the best advantage and to work as a well-functioning department.
* Stay well-informed about industry trends and advancements, consistently update knowledge in line with emerging developments, to enhance credibility and provide a service based on up-to-date expertise.
* This role would be a hybrid set up from either Malmö or Stockholm


**We offer YOU**
* A competitive salary package with bonus system, and a referral program
* A stable and growing company with an entrepreneurial mindset where we will listen to your ideas and support you to make it happen
* High flexibility and hybrid work is part of our DNA
* State-of-the-art offices with our unique co-living-co-working concept where teamwork is the norm
* International growing opportunities and internal mobility
* Events: team lunches, after work, sports, trips
* Learning opportunities: languages, tech, product, sales techniques, leadership


 Do you have questions about this position? Please contact jobs@efficy.com
   

  

 Find more jobs at https://jobs.efficy.com.
   

  

  

  

*efficy is a people-first employer. We offer equal opportunities to all our candidates. We pride ourselves on the diversity of our people. We welcome you, and everything that makes you—well, you. That includes your gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, age, or disability status. So, if you’re interested in joining us, please feel free to apply. We can’t wait to meet* 
*you!*
**Disclaimer**
 efficy is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. Please, no phone calls or emails. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at efficy via email, the Internet, or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of efficy. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by efficy as a result of an unsolicited referral or through other means.

title: Customer Service Desk Manager Nordics
description:
As the Nordics Customer Service Desk Manager, you will oversee a team of 16 members across Norway, Sweden, and Denmark, ensuring the Customer Service Desk delivers great service. Your role involves setting and executing strategy, driving process improvements, and fostering a happy and high performing team. You will coach and support your team and collaborate with the Operations Management team to achieve the vision.
   

  

 As part of our ongoing efforts to enhance our operations, we are restructuring to place a stronger emphasis on customer service. Currently, our managers oversee multiple teams across various countries. To better focus on this area, we are seeking a dedicated Customer Service Desk Manager Nordics.
   

  

 Find out more here about how you can unleash your full potential at DLL.
   

  

 Day to day
   

  

* Coaching and supporting team members, which will involve traveling to other locations, conducting touchpoints, and facilitating improvements within the Customer Service Desk.
* Developing the Customer Service Desk (CSD) in the Nordics with a focus on process improvement.
* Be a driving force within the Operations leadership team.
* Leverage the needs of CSD with other internal stakeholders.
* You will collaborate with 10 colleagues in the management team to ensure the vision is effectively executed


**All members enjoy**
* Two working days per year volunteering for a local charity.
* Health and Wellness program, free health checks, fun health & vitality activities.
* Flexible hours with possibility to work from home.
* Career development opportunities: online learning, member development programs.
* Check this link to an overview of all benefits in your region.


**“We not only live up to the expectations of our customers for today, but also anticipate their market needs of tomorrow.”**
 Essentials
   

  

 As a leader, you excel in workforce planning, developing the Customer Service Desk, and motivating the team to reach their full potential. As you are managing your team in three different countries it is of course important that you have strong leadership skills, and that you can adapt between managing your team remotely and face-to-face.
   

  

 You are comfortable challenging the status quo and not afraid to question existing processes to suggest innovative improvements. Taking initiative and ensuring actions are taken to achieve tangible results is second nature to you. You support your members and are not afraid to provide constructive feedback on a regular basis.
   

  

* Minimum of 3 years of experience in a leadership position.
* Proven experience in a customer-facing role.
* Demonstrated ability to manage off-site teams effectively.
* Strong results-oriented leadership skills.
* Fluent in Swedish, Norwegian or Danish as well as fluenct in English.


 Choose wellbeing
   

  

 DLL’s wellbeing ambition is to educate, equip and empower members to build connections, manage their mental, emotional, physical and financial wellness and maintain balance between work and the other priorities that make up their lives.
   

  

**Our Four Wellbeing Categories Are As Follows**
* Connection – Build meaningful connections with other DLL members
* Health – Manage mental, emotional and physical health
* Finance – Provide learning opportunities to help members achieve personal financial health
* Lifestyle – Maintain balance between work and life priorities


 These are the things that matter to our members and the wellbeing of our members matters to DLL!
   

  

**Setting in**
 At DLL, we are many things. We are team members, family members, community member. We are members of society, members of different cultures and nationalities. Members of change. We each have different beliefs, different passions, different viewpoints, talents and interests. We become from different backgrounds, cultures, nationalities and histories. But for all of our differences, we share one thing in common: each of us are members of DLL.
   

  

 Our company was founded in the Netherlands. But today we are truly a multinational business. Our unique culture is rooted in higher collaboration, less hierarchy and a honest directness that enable us to integrate, ideate and innovate across country lines.
   

  

 Many companies say they are European, American, Asian or Australian, at DLL we are all these places and more. We are a cross-culture collaborative – an interconnected network – that comes together every single day with one goal in mind:
 **Partnering for a better world**
 Our Organisation
   

  

 DLL is a global vendor finance company with more than EUR 38 billion in assets. Founded in 1969 and headquartered in Eindhoven, the Netherlands, DLL provides asset-based financial solutions in the Agriculture, Food, Healthcare, Clean Technology, Construction, Transportation, Industrial, Office Equipment and Technology industries. DLL partners with equipment manufacturers, dealers and distributors in more than 25 countries to support their distribution channels and help grow their businesses. DLL combines customer focus with deep industry knowledge to deliver sustainable solutions for the complete asset life cycle, including commercial finance, retail finance and used equipment finance. DLL is a wholly owned subsidiary of Rabobank Group. To learn more about DLL, visit www.dllgroup.com.
   

  

 Good to know
   

  

* Deadline for application: 28.02.2025 (application deadline may close sooner if a high number of applications are received)
* Location: Oslo, Copehagen and Stockholm
* The selection process may involve an assessment.
* Applications via email will not be reviewed. Please apply online via our career website.
* DLL’s referral program applies
* #IND123
* For more information, please contact our Talent Acquisition Partner Joep Staps via joep.staps@dllgroup.com


 DLL appreciates the time you spend applying to our openings. We advise only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted. Hiring subject to successful completion of a background check.
   

  

 DLL is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes and work environments. If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise Human Resources if you require accommodation in accordance with our values and all applicable legislation.

title: Erfaren IT-infrastrukturspecialist till globalt företag
description:
Till vår kund i centrala Stockholm söker vi en erfaren och engagerad IT-infrastrukturspecialist som vill arbeta med drift och förvaltning av en stabil och affärskritisk IT-miljö tillsammans med ett sammansvetsat infrastrukturteam. Här får du en nyckelroll där du arbetar brett med serverhantering, nätverk och säkerhet i en miljö som ständigt utvecklas.
   

  

 Tjänsten börjar som ett konsultuppdrag via Centric, och efter sex månader kommer anställningen att övergå direkt till kunden. Detta är en utmärkt möjlighet för dig som vill ta nästa steg i din karriär och bidra med din expertis i en internationell organisation med långsiktigt fokus på tillförlitlig IT-infrastruktur.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter**
* Hantering av virtuella maskiner (implementering, förvaltning och avveckling) i VMware- och Nutanix-miljö
* Hantering av Windows servermiljön (onprem)
* Felsökning och drift av Cisco LAN och trådlösa nätverk
* Leda och delta i projekt
* Hantering av brandväggsregler och ständigt förbättra säkerheten i våra miljöer
* Självständigt och tillsammans med andra lokala och globala team vara drivande i att utveckla befintlig miljö och implementera nya system
* Incidenthantering
* Stötta verksamheten vid implementering och uppgradering av verksamhetssystem


**Din Profil Och KvalifikationerKrav**
* Minst 4-6 års yrkeserfarenhet inom relevanta områden
* Relevant högskole-/universitetsutbildning och CCNA eller motsvarande kunskap
* Erfarenhet av drift och underhåll av nätverk, Windows serverar, Active Directory, GPO och VMware
* Scripting kunskaper
* Flytande i tal och skrift i både svenska och engelska


*Det är meriterande om du har gått kurser eller innehar certifikat från VMware, Nutanix, Microsoft, Cisco och ITIL.*
**Vad vi erbjuder** 
 På Centric får du de verktyg du behöver för att nå dina mål. Vi erbjuder alla våra konsulter kvalificerade utbildningar och certifieringar inom den senaste tekniken. Vi tycker nämligen att våra medarbetare hela tiden ska fortsätta att utvecklas. Därför erbjuder vi dig möjligheten att lägga upp en individuell utbildningsplan, där vi bekostar såväl studiematerial som själva certifieringarna. Under din utveckling kommer vi matcha din kompetens mot rätt uppdrag i takt med att du avancerar. Vi genomför regelbundet spännande aktiviteter där du som konsult får möjlighet att träffa och umgås med dina kollegor under roliga och avslappnande former.
   

  

*Mer om oss*
 Centric är ett IT-företag med 380 anställda, med kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö och Linköping. Vi specialiserar oss på uthyrning av generalister och förmedling av specialister samt erbjuder outsourcing och systemlösningar inom retail. Vi är medlem i Almega Kompetensföretagen och följer deras tecknade kollektivavtal med Unionen.

title: Teknisk IT-säkerhetssamordnare till PRI, Stockholm
description:
**PRI i Stockholm söker en operativ IT-säkerhetssamordnare för att stärka vårt säkerhetsarbete och hantera framtidens utmaningar!**
 Vi befinner oss i en spännande fas med nya initiativ och utveckling av moderna säkerhetstjänster för att möta både interna behov och externa krav. Som IT-säkerhetssamordnare får du en nyckelroll i att omsätta strategiska riktlinjer till konkreta lösningar. Du arbetar i vårt interna techteam och du har nära samarbete med CISO, vår strategiska driftpartner och våra övriga utvecklingsteam. Du är en viktig del i att säkerställa att PRI håller högsta nivå på informations- och IT-säkerhet i en värld som ständigt förändras. Om du söker en roll där du kan påverka, bidra och växa – då kan detta vara din nästa utmaning!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
* Möjligheten att spela en central roll i att utveckla och förvalta IT-säkerhetstjänster för hela PRI.
* Att vara en del av en organisation vars kultur kännetecknas av det lilla företaget med stora framtidsplaner, utrymme för påverkan och goda möjligheter till personlig utveckling.
* En arbetsgivare som värderar balans mellan privat- och arbetsliv med bra personalförmåner så som subventionerade luncher, centralt kontor med cykelgarage och högt friskvårdsbidrag.
* En dynamisk miljö med möjlighet att påverka och bidra till framtidens IT-säkerhetslösningar.


**Det här gör du hos oss**
 Som IT-säkerhetssamordnare Ansvarar Du För Att Operativt Omsätta Våra Riktlinjer Och Instruktioner Inom IT- Och Informationssäkerhet Till Praktiska Lösningar. Dina Uppgifter Inkluderar
   

  

* Koordinering av sårbarhetshantering tillsammans med driftleverantörer och interna intressenter.
* Granskning av säkerheten i lösningar för egenutvecklade applikationer och externa tjänster.
* Delta i arbetet av säkerhetstester enligt interna riktlinjer och kundkrav.
* Identifiering och hantering av säkerhetsavvikelser och risker.
* Ständigt bidra till förbättring av säkerheten genom att komma med förslag, implementera nya arbetssätt, samt bistå i den praktiska hanteringen av säkerhetshöjande förändringar.
* Aktivt deltagande i forum som säkerhets-, förändrings- och sårbarhetsforum.
* Incidenthantering i samarbete med driftleverantör och interna team.
* Förvaltning och förbättring av interna säkerhetstjänster och verktyg.


**Ditt team och arbetsplats**
 Avdelningen Utveckling & Innovation (U&I) har idag drygt 60 medarbetare, både anställda och konsulter. Avdelningen består av erfarna och duktiga medarbetare som verkar i en kreativ miljö och som har roligt tillsammans. PRI sitter centralt på Regeringsgatan 28 i Stockholm där vi ses majoriteten av tiden med möjlighet att jobba på distans vid behov.
   

  

**Mer om dig**
 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har en grund inom data- och systemvetenskap, IT- och informationssäkerhet eller närliggande område, samt erfarenhet av liknande arbete. Du har kännedom om relevanta standarder och ramverk, såsom ISO 27000, NIST, OWASP och ITIL, och du har en stark förståelse för riskhantering inom IT- och informationssäkerhet.
   

  

 Du har en teknisk förståelse och dina kommunikativa och analytiska förmågor är välutvecklade. För att trivas i rollen så är du samarbetsorienterad, nyfiken, lösningsfokuserad och gillar att driva initiativ framåt i en dynamisk miljö.
   

  

**Så här får vi kontakt**
 I den här rekryteringen har vi valt att samarbeta med Ada Digital som strävar efter en transparent, inkluderande och snabbrörlig rekryteringsupplevelse. Vi vill veta mer om dig och din potential! Du söker tjänsten enkelt och behöver inte bifoga några dokument. Det räcker med en motivering till varför du söker tjänsten och om du saknar CV kan du bifoga din LinkedIn-profil. Följ sedan din ansökan live via vår hemsida. Urvalet sker löpande och tjänsten kan bli tillsatt före sista ansökningsdatum. Är du nyfiken och vill veta mer innan du söker? Hör av dig till ansvarig rekryterare. Vi ser fram emot att få kontakt med dig!

title: Senior Solutions Architect
company_industry: Software Development, Computer Networking Products, and Computer and Network Security
description:
**Description**
 It’s an exciting time to be at Infoblox. Named a Top 25 Cyber Security Company by The Software Report and one of
 *Inc* 
 . magazine’s Best Workplaces for 2020, Infoblox is the leader in cloud-first networking and security services. Our solutions empower organizations to take full advantage of the cloud to deliver network experiences that are inherently simple, scalable, and reliable for everyone. Infoblox customers are among the largest enterprises in the world and include 70% of the Fortune 500 and 93 of the Fortune 100, and our success depends on bright, energetic, talented people who share a passion for building the next generation of networking technologies—and having fun along the way.
   

  

 We are looking for a Senior Solutions Architect in Sweden to join our EMEA sales team, reporting to the manager for the Solution Architects team for the region. In this role, the main focus is working closely with our world-class sales team to overcome and remove all technical barriers in the sales process. This trusted technical advisor will help the sales team develop new business by working directly with customers and partners, effectively positioning Infoblox solutions.
   

  

 You’re the ideal candidate if you are a strategic thinker with a strong networking and security background, understand complex SaaS selling, work well independently, and are results-driven.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
* Build business cases and technical differentiation in sales opportunities by educating customers and partners about Infoblox solution
* Develop pre-sales engineering content—presentations, demos, and webinars—on Infoblox solutions for customer and partner audiences
* Design solutions and architectural diagrams that convey proposed Infoblox solutions, how they will be engineered, and how they will integrate with other vendors
* Educate partner technical sales teams about Infoblox solutions and technologies and when/how they can identify opportunities and position Infoblox solutions to customers
* Work closely with your primary account manager and support the rest of the team in your areas of core competency
* Evaluate and identify new opportunities within existing accounts to expand with more Infoblox solutions


**What you’ll bring:**
* Experience in Cloud/Security space with working knowledge of design and implementation for at least one of the following: AWS, Azure, VMWare, Kubernetes, or HBSS, Nextgen Firewalls, TIPS, IPS/IDS, DevOps
* 3+ years of experience supporting technical sales or 5+ years of experience in engineering or operations networking
* 3+ years of experience in networking technologies, including TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, LAN/WAN, Routing, Switching, Firewalls, IPv4/v6, UNIX Admin, and experience with switches, routers, and firewalls in Intranet/Internet/Extranet environments
* Strong knowledge of general security best practices and direct experience with at least one security product
* Strong interpersonal and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate complex technology simply
* Conscientious attitude and dependability, self-starter, ability to work independently while appreciating teamwork and communication
* DDI -- DNS/DHCP/IPAM experience
* CCSP, CISSP, CASP+, CySA+ CEH technical certifications a plus
* Bachelor's Degree
* Fluency in English and Swedish


**What success looks like:**
 After six months, you will…
   

  

* Have a foundational knowledge of our entire product/solution portfolio
* Demonstrate fluency with either on-prem or SaaS-based Infoblox solutions
* Identify 1-2 specialization areas
* Capable of handling primary SA customer-facing tasks with only occasional help from others


**After About a Year, You Will…**
* Demonstrate fluency with all Infoblox solutions
* Capable of handling advanced SA customer-facing tasks with only occasional help from others
* Able to conduct POCs & customer demos with little to no supervision
* Go-to person for specialization area for assigned region


**We’ve got you covered:**
 Our holistic
 **benefits** 
 package includes coverage of your health, wealth, and wellness—as well as a great work environment, employee programs, and company culture. We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and generous paid time off to help you balance your life. We have a strong culture and live our
 **values** 
 every day—we believe in transparency, curiosity, respect, and above all, having fun while delighting our customers.
   

  

**Why Infoblox?**
 We’ve created a culture that embraces
 **diversity, equity, and inclusion** 
 and rewards innovation, curiosity, and creativity. We achieve remarkable results by working together in a supportive environment that focuses on continuous learning and embraces change. So, whether you’re a software engineer, marketing manager, customer care pro, or product specialist, you belong here, where you will have the opportunity to grow and develop your career. Check out
 **what it’s like to be a Bloxer** 
 . We think you’ll be excited to join our team

title: Compliance Coordinator
description:
At Billogram we like to be the good guys of billing, making money when clients are happy and pay on time rather than from missed payments. We believe it always pays off to treat people well. That’s why our platform for invoices and payments is built to remove pain, and instead be of gain to both our clients and their customers – improving their relations.
   

  

 To ensure continuous growth and become a leader in the European consumer billing market we are looking for a Compliance Coordinator to join our team.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Compliance Coordinator at Billogram, you’ll play a crucial role in developing, administrating and coordinating compliance processes across the organization. While the primary focus will be AML and CFT, your work will also encompass broader compliance areas like GDPR, DORA, outsourcing, vendor management, risk management, and fostering collaboration across teams. Acting as the central hub for compliance initiatives, this role blends operational support, project coordination and strategy to ensure our processes run efficiently and align with regulatory requirements.
   

  

**Primary Responsibilities**
* Coordinate compliance initiatives, ensuring alignment with regulations and organizational objectives (e.g. AML/CFT, GDPR, DORA, risk assessments).
* Lead compliance projects by setting clear goals, timelines, and facilitating collaboration across departments.
* Support the development and implementation of AML/CFT processes in collaboration with internal stakeholders and subject matter experts.
* Analyze and address concerns from monitoring processes to ensure timely and compliant resolution.
* Manage compliance-related systems like CM1, ensuring they meet operational and regulatory needs.
* Act as the central communicator between 1st and 2nd line functions to ensure alignment in compliance activities.
* Organize training initiatives to raise awareness of compliance policies, including AML/CFT and GDPR.
* Prepare reports and documentation for internal and external reviews.


**What We Are Looking For**
 As a person, you approach work methodically, ensuring that processes are efficient and well-organized. You enjoy a project-oriented role that includes administrative tasks and take a practical, solution-focused approach to challenges. You’re proactive, not afraid to take initiative, and stay committed to seeing tasks through, even when obstacles arise. Collaboration comes naturally to you, and you’re skilled at working across teams to align compliance efforts with broader business objectives.
   

  

 Skills & traits which will help you succeed in this role:
   

  

* Hands-on experience with KYC and AML processes, including identifying risks, resolving issues, and ensuring compliance with complex regulatory requirements.
* Previous exposure to compliance and regulatory frameworks, with a proven ability to navigate and apply them effectively.
* Proficiency in managing or supporting compliance-related projects, including coordinating with multiple stakeholders.
* Strong interest in promoting compliance awareness throughout the organization.
* Knowledge of the AML system CM1 (Softronic) is considered a plus.
* A university degree within law or a related field is a plus.
* Fluency in both written and spoken Swedish and English is a requirement.


 Why work with us?
   

  

 At Billogram we promise you an exciting journey as we break into new markets and grow at a rapid pace. That aside you will get lots of freedom and opportunity to develop together with great colleagues at our office, right in the center of Stockholm. We also offer flexible working hours, exciting challenges and a whole lot of laughs.
   

  

 We're committed to your long-term development, offering clear career progression paths. You'll also enjoy a fantastic benefits package, including 30 (+2) days of holiday, an occupational pension, a flexible wellness allowance, sick leave top-up, and parental leave compensation. At Billogram, our inclusive and diverse culture ensures that everyone can enjoy a fulfilling career and a great work-life balance.
   

  

*At Billogram, we provide equal opportunities and strive for an inclusive and diverse environment. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to gender, transgender identity or expression, ethnicity, religion or other beliefs, disability, sexual orientation, or age.*
 Welcome to the world of Billogram!
   

  

 Since its inception in 2011, Billogram has fundamentally transformed how companies view invoicing. With an innovative, cloud-based platform, Billogram manages the entire invoice-to-cash process. It turns invoicing into an interactive, data-driven, and customer-focused experience.
   

  

 Our platform optimizes operational efficiency and increases customer lifetime value for businesses with recurring revenue. By replacing traditional PDF and paper invoices with an automated solution, Billogram reduces manual steps, lowers churn, and enhances the customer experience.
   

  

 Serving clients across Europe, Billogram combines efficiency, user-friendliness, and smart technology to help large and midsize businesses build stronger customer relationships, reduce customer service cases, and gain a competitive edge in a rapidly evolving market.

title: Customer Service Specialist
description:
*Are you a looking for a full-time job in customer service?* 




*Do you speak fluent Dutch?* 




  





**ABOUT THE COMPANY** 




 GANT is the future of American Sportswear and has been a pioneer of preppy style since 1949. Founded by the Gantmacher family in the college town of New Haven, Connecticut, GANT revolutionized the way the world dresses by creating American Sportswear icons. Today we continue to challenge convention and make clothes for the courageous, the curious and the creative - a community of people who believe you should never stop learning.
 



  





 GANT enjoys a global presence in over 70 markets, with 600 stores, 4,000 selected retailers and with a team of 1500 employees globally. We strive to become employer of choice within premium lifestyle and are always looking for new passionate people to join their team.
 



  





**ABOUT THE ROLE** 




 As a Customer Service Agent for the Central European markets you will support customers mainly over phone and email. You will help GANTS customers before, during and after a purchase, Monday-Friday 10-18. You will be the first personal contact point to the brand.
 



 Prior to the shifts, you will receive a 2 weeks onboarding, which will take place during the usual office hours Monday-Friday 9-17.
 



  





**RESPONSIBILITIES** 



* Support customers with queries in relation to orders, products, stores or loyalty program, to name a few, within the tonality guidelines, which is done primarily via Service Cloud.
* Report any issues to the E-Commerce teams and the Customer Service Manager
* Handover cases and issues handled to the inhouse team



  





**WHO ARE YOU?** 




 To be successful in this role we believe that you speak the Dutch language fluently. Any additional languages, such as German, Swedish or English is also mandatory. It is an advantage if you have previous experience in customer service or working in digital platforms.
 



 But most importantly we believe that you are:
 



 • A solution-oriented fast learner who can handle digital platforms
 



 • Service minded and friendly
 



 • Communicative and not afraid to ask for help
 



  





 Does this sound like something for you? We look forward to your application.
 



  





**OTHER INFORMATION:** 




**Start:** 
 As per agreement
 



**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Hybrid solution
 



**Employment form:** 
 This is a full-time consultancy position where you will be hired as a consultant through A-hub.

title: Head of Sustainability Sverige
description:
Vill du leda och driva hållbarhetsarbetet i Sveriges största IT-företag? Corporate Knights har utnämnt Atea till ett av de 100 mest hållbara företagen i världen fyra år i rad, men för oss är det långt ifrån tillräckligt. Vi har höga ambitioner för tiden som kommer och mycket arbete kvarstår. Därför söker Atea Sverige en Hållbarhetschef som har ett starkt driv och ett genuint engagemang för hållbarhet som kan ta vårt hållbarhetsarbete till nästa nivå.
   

  

 I rollen som Hållbarhetschef får du möjlighet att kombinera strategiskt och operativt arbete. Du kommer att arbeta nära affärsverksamheten och ha ett brett ansvarsområde som inkluderar klimatstrategi, leverantörsansvar, affärsutveckling och extern påverkan.
   

  

 Du kommer att vara med att implementera och driva Ateas hållbarhetsstrategi i Sverige i linje med koncernens mål. Samt stötta säljorganisationen med att integrera hållbarhet i kunddialoger och affärsstrategier, arbeta tätt med företagsledning, affärsområden och koncernnivå för att säkerställa att hållbarhet är en naturlig del av verksamheten.
   

  

 En stor del i rollen är att driva och förvalta samarbeten med externa intressenter och andra nyckelaktörer. För att lyckas i rollen måste du ha förmågan att skapa engagemang och sprida kunskap i hållbarhetsfrågor, där har du en ledande roll att inspirera till interna initiativ, men också externt representera Atea Sverige i olika forum, konferenser, och events för att driva på förändringen inom IT-branschen. Som hålbarhetschef för Atea Sverige kommer du att rapportera direkt till vår koncernchef för hållbarhet.

title: Infrastructure Lead
description:
**Description**
*Position at LeoVegas Group*
**About The Role**
 Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) is a critical part of our platform strategy. As a leader of the SRE team, you will focus on guiding your team in providing technical expertise and support to our engineering teams to enable them to deliver high-quality software solutions efficiently.
   

  

 Your team will be responsible for providing continuous support to other departments, overcoming major technical hurdles, improving performance , implementing system monitoring and building highly available software.
   

  

 YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:
   

  

* Providing support and leadership for our SRE team to solve operational challenges.
* Managing the assignment of tasks for the team according to priorities and capacity.
* Having a positive attitude and the ability to understand the critical urgency of topics and strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Ensuring non-functional requirements for all applications and tools are met and clearly communicated.
* Providing counsel to our internal software engineering team and proactively suggesting improvements on how to operate our microservice-based solution.
* Provide informal feedback on an ongoing basis and formal feedback in the annual performance evaluation process to identify and develop talent.
* Coaching Payments Product team members in achieving goals and developing necessary skills.
* Organise team trainings and initiatives.
* Identify team goals and evaluate team progress.


 OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE THE FOLLOWING:
   

  

**Essential Skills**
* Minimum 5 years of software engineering or devops experience.
* Minimum 2 years of experience as a team lead or manager.
* Practical experience in using common cloud APIs.
* Strong knowledge of Linux and shell scripting, as well as higher level protocols and patterns like HTTP/3, REST, JSON and gRPC.
* Expertise in systems integration and distributed large scale microservice deployments.
* Experience in operating and monitoring container workloads and similar technologies.
* Strong code reading and understanding skills with at least one high level programming language


 NICE TO HAVES
   

  

* Experience from the iGaming industry is meriting


**Who We Are**
 At the core of LeoVegas Group is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. We’re a team of over 1800 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 16 offices worldwide.
   

  

**Benefits**
* Hybrid work policy.
* 4 weeks of Workation (T&C apply).
* 30 annual vacation days.
* Occupational Pension.
* 5,000 SEK wellness contribution annually.
* Parental Leave Top-Up.
* Possibility to enroll in a private health care insurance for both you and your partner.
* 1,500 SEK equipment allowance.
* Benify - benefits portal with many offers and discounts.
* We offer a relocation package with accommodation and flights.


 JOIN US
   

  

 In our pride, we empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don’t wait for things to happen; we pounce and make it happen!
   

  

 Would you be a good fit for the Leo Pride - give us a roar!
   

  

* As our company working language is English, we’d like to see your CV in English, please\*\*

title: Business Analyst till Movestic
job_function: Business Development, Product Management, and Project Management
description:
För att fortsätta ligga i framkant på pensions- och försäkringsmarknaden håller vi en hög utvecklingstakt. Med genuin omtanke för våra kunder tar vi Movestic till nästa nivå i våra tekniska lösningar, digitala tjänster, produkter och via externa samarbeten. Därför söker vi nu en Business analyst som vill vara en central och avgörande del av vårt arbete framåt.
 



  





 Rollen som business analyst har en tyngdpunk på kravställning och test. Du stöttar verksamheten från idé till implementation. Du driver kravställning och diskuterar lösningar med tyngdpunkt på det tekniska perspektivet. Du jobbar nära både front-end och back-end samt vårt testteam. Vid behov deltar du även i och driver hantering av felrapportering genom att utreda buggar och fel samt tar fram lösningar.
 



  





 Du deltar även i möten för planering och samordning av pågående såväl som kommande utveckling. Du kommer att jobba i en grupp med specialister och Business Analyst. I denna roll tillhör du Operations och rapporterar till chefen för Operations.
 



  





**Din profil** 




 Vi tror att du har bred erfarenhet av jobb där du varit involverad i projekt, test- och eller kravställning. eller jobbat som projektledare med fokus på tekniken inom reglerad branschbranschen.
 



  





 Erfarenhet från försäkrings- finansbranschen är meriterande men inget krav.
 



  





 Som person är du drivande, vågar ställa krav som tar er framåt och trivs i en roll där du kan ta ett stort eget ansvar. Med en vilja att både utmana och själv bli utmanad kan du lätt sätta dig in i olika kollegors perspektiv. Denna kombination gör att du är duktig på att förstå, fånga upp och definiera olika behov samtidigt som du är uppskattad i tvärfunktionella team. Du har en god förmåga att skapa samarbeten och på ett smidigt sätt få med dig folk.
 



  





 Självklart arbetar du strukturerat, vilket är en förutsättning för att kunna planera och samordna våra många interna utvecklingsinitiativ.
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Movestic med Level Up Consulting.
 



  





 Intervjuer genomförs löpande så ansök redan idag.

title: Process Executor
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Job Description**
 You will own and lead the event management process across the organization, ensuring operational stability, efficiency, and alignment with business objectives. You will design, implement, and continuously improve the event management framework, focusing on proactive operations, incident prevention, and streamlined event handling. Your work will directly impact how we manage and respond to events in real time, driving improvements in operational efficiency and customer satisfaction.
   

  

**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* Proven experience in process management, preferably within Event Management or a similar ITIL-aligned process.
* Strong understanding of IT service management tools, such as ServiceNow, Splunk, and GCP monitoring solutions.
* Experience with predictive and proactive operations, leveraging AI/ML tools for operational stability.
* Familiarity with incident management, change management, and problem management processes.
* Exceptional analytical skills, with the ability to interpret data and provide actionable insights.
* Experience working in agile environments, collaborating with cross-functional teams.


**Meritorious**
* Experience with process automation tools like UiPath or similar frameworks.
* Knowledge of event correlation and noise reduction methodologies.
* Strong communication and leadership skills, with the ability to influence and drive cross-team alignment.


**Education**
* Bachelor’s degree in IT, Computer Science, Business Administration, or a related field.
* ITIL certification (Intermediate or higher) is a plus.


**Application deadline:** 
 11-02-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Head of Commercial Management
company_industry: Telecommunications and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Telia is like a hub in Swedish business, where we have earned our customers' trust for decades. My name is Niclas Krantz, and within my business unit, BU Enterprise Solutions, we have the privilege of working with the largest Swedish enterprises, authorities, regions, and municipalities.
   

  

 I am currently looking for a
 **Head of Commercial Management** 
 to support the development of the unit.
   

  

**Your next challenge?**
 The Commercial Management team has two main responsibilities.
   

  

 The first area is to drive the Commercial Management agenda with the aim to maximize growth and profitability for a defined service area through differentiated value propositions (product, bundles, price, campaigns, marketing) and by optimizing execution in available sales channels and to targeted customer sub segments.
   

  

 The second responsibility include is the pricing agenda and the team set the winning price with deal specific pricing and pricing strategies, development of business cases for our largest deals, business case follow-up, price steering through management of price mandates, development of price models and pricing tools.
   

  

 The commercial management team is the commercial coaches to the sales organization.
   

  

**Key responsibilities:**
* Develop and execute value propositions and sales execution to optimize growth and profitability
* Define deal-specific pricing, manage price mandates, and develop pricing models and strategies
* Create and evaluate business cases for major deals to ensure profitability.
* Support and coach Sales teams to strengthen sales execution and strategy.


 You will report to me, Niclas Krantz, Head of BU Enterprise Solutions at B2B Telia.
   

  

**Who are you?**
 To succeed in our mission, I need a leader who understand the enterprise and public customer segment, have a good overarching understanding of the B2B portfolio and who is a leader who can build relationships quickly with the team but also interfacing stakeholder organizations such as B2B Offering Management, Telia Cygate portfolio team as well as Group Technology.
   

  

 I believe in leaders who, through continuous feedback and coaching of their teams, take clear accountability to ensure we are on the right track and can back this up with data. That is why I am looking for you, who are driven, experienced and skilled and who want to be part of this journey.
   

  

**Your Experience**
* Experience from large and complex B2B commercial management roles
* Leadership experience in large and complex organizations
* Experience from the telecom and IT sector with deep understanding of the industry logic
* Experience from driving successful change in large / matrix organizations
* Ability to communicate efficiently both in English and Swedish


**Your Skills**
* Solution-oriented and pragmatic
* Communicative leader who builds trust and collaborations around the organization
* Analytical, structured, responsible, and easy to deal with
* Team player who can roll up the sleeves


**More Than Just a Job!**
 No matter what position you apply for with us, we provide you with the tools and support you need to drive your personal development. We want to help you grow both personally and professionally. With us, you become part of a creative, motivating, and welcoming company where everyone can be themselves, with equal opportunities for growth. We respect people and value diversity. In addition to an attractive and inclusive work environment, we offer flexibility and a wide range of benefits.
   

  

**Interested?**
 Don’t hesitate to submit your application if you want to be part of our team! Selection is ongoing.
   

  

 If you’d like to know more about the role, feel free to contact Talent Partner Christine Wilén at christine.wilen@teliacompany.com.
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application. To ensure the secure handling of your personal data, please apply through our recruitment system. We are unable to accept applications via email or other channels. Background checks are conducted as part of our recruitment process.
   

  

**Welcome to Telia – Home to your next big Opportunity!**

title: Senior Game Designer to Hearts of Iron
description:
*As a Game Designer you will be focusing on designing and balancing engaging gameplay mechanics. Hearts of Iron, the grand strategy wargame, have over a million players monthly (and growing) expectantly waiting for what’s next for their favorite franchise.*
**Game Designer Hearts of Iron**
 We're on the lookout for a game designer driven by a passion for their craft and a fervor for crafting thrilling experiences for our players. If you're someone who finds motivation in the autonomy to lead tasks and deliver outstanding results, you're the ideal fit. Your element is a creative and collaborative space where the enthusiasm for our work is infectious, and everyone around you is not just doing a job but crafting the games we all love
 **.** 
 A keen interest in history and its narratives is a great plus.
   

  

**Your mission**
 You will be working closely with the Game Director and be the owner of the design in feature teams. Taking ownership of the designs means that you will be working hands-on from research, to design, implementation and balancing of gameplay systems. This includes being adept at communicating with your peers and colleagues in other disciplines, writing and maintaining design documents as well as testing implemented features and making sure they live up to expectations.
   

  

 Your role goes beyond crafting engaging game play - it involves actively engaging with our community, giving sneak peaks of yours & the team's latest for work as well as working closely with our marketing team to come up with the best way to showcase the game. In doing this you will be central to shaping the interaction with the people that matters most to us - our players.
   

  

**Skills That We Are Looking For**
* Solid work experience in system design
* Solid work experience in gameplay design
* Experience with scripting
* Interest in strategy/war games; PDS games in particular
* Fluency in English


 As a creative force at Paradox, you are expected to have a genuine passion for Grand Strategy Games and a good understanding of what makes them so appealing to our players.
   

  

*We will only recruit locally for this position*
 Today, Paradox consists of both publishing and internal game development. We have a broad portfolio of games and own the most important brands, including Stellaris, Europa Universalis, Hearts of Iron, Crusader Kings, Cities: Skylines, Prison Architect, Victoria, Age of Wonders and the World of Darkness catalog of brands.
   

  

 Since 2004, the company has published its games all over the world, initially through physical distribution but primarily in digital channels after 2006. Paradox games are developed primarily for PC and console platforms, but the company also releases games on mobile. The largest markets today include the US, UK, China, Germany, France and Scandinavia. In total, Paradox games have over five million players each month.

title: Power Platform Consultant
description:
Sii Sweden is looking for a Power Platform Consultant to be part of our Microsoft 365 Competency Center, a team of over 100 cloud specialists. Join us to work on hundreds of challenging projects for clients from various industries, from automotive, through healthcare, to hi-tech, and more!
   

  

 We are dedicated to support the development of our employees. This is why we have a broad training and mentoring offer, as well as other benefits like a pension plan, insurance, wellness package, regular after-work, and more.
   

  

**Your tasks**
* Lead the design and architecture of business solutions using the Microsoft Power Platform
* Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand their requirements and translate them into technical solutions
* Provide expertise on the capabilities and limitations of the Power Platform, and recommend the best approach to meet business needs
* Ensure the scalability, security, and performance of solutions
* Guide and mentor development teams during the implementation phase, ensuring best practices are followed
* Stay updated on the latest features and updates in the Power Platform and related Microsoft technologies
* Lead the integration of Power Platform solutions with other systems and technologies
* Conduct workshops and training sessions for clients and team members on the Power Platform


**Requirements**
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field
* Experience as a Senior Consultant/Architect or similar role, with a strong focus on the Microsoft Power Platform
* Deep understanding of Power Platform (Power BI, Power Apps, Power Automate), and its application in business environments
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to design complex solutions
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
* Relevant Microsoft certifications, such as the Microsoft Certified: Power Platform Solution Architect Expert
* Familiarity with other Microsoft solutions and their integration with the Power Platform, like Azure, Dynamics 365, Logic Apps, and Microsoft 365 would be an advantage
* Proficiency in Swedish and English


 Job no. 250206-8JQQF

title: Associate Programme Officer, Constitution Building
Sales Executive
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Banking
description:
We are now seeking a talented Sales Executive to join Tietoevry's Financial Crime Prevention business. Are you the one to join their ambitious team and drive growth of their Financial Crime Prevention offerings in the European markets?
 



 If so, we can promise you a flexible position with a high pace that gives you the opportunity to build new business and develop clients and prospects.
 



 The role is located in Stockholm or Oslo and will require international travel. The Sales Executive will report directly to Head of Sales.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Building and managing a sales pipeline focused on generating new sales leads and opportunities in the European markets, with focus to grow Tietoevry´s footprint outside Nordics.
* Own and drive cases throughout the entire sales process, from initial contact to signing.
* Work closely with marketing and product teams to drive lead-generating activities.
* Assess new sales partnership opportunities, attract new relevant partners, and run pipeline growth with selected partners to support their international sales growth.
* Actively contribute to develop and refine Tietoevry´s go-to-market strategy.



  





**Background and experience** 



* University degree or the equivalent combination of education, training, or work experience that enables you to navigate through banking- and IT businesses.
* Documented experience in selling financial software or SaaS and/or complex solutions internationally. Experience within Fraud, AML, Identity, or payment technology domains is a merit.
* A genuine interest in financial crime prevention and want to position yourself as a trusted advisor in your business relationship.
* Strong negotiating skills with experience handling complex contracts.
* Fluency in English. Scandinavian language is a merit.



  





 As a person you are a natural self-starter with a passion for sales and business development. Proactive and driven, you thrive in high-paced environments, take ownership of your work, and enjoy building strong relationships. With a positive attitude and attention to detail, you’re confident in navigating long-term, complex sales cycles and engaging with stakeholders at all levels.
 



  





 If this sounds like your kind of challenge, apply today by submitting your CV and cover letter!
 



 In this recruitment process Tietoevry is collaborating with Novare Executive Search.
 



 For more information about the position or the process, please contact Johanna Svensson, johanna.svensson@novare.se. Please note that we do not accept applications through e-mail.
 



  





***About Tietoevry***




*Tietoevry is a leading global technology company with Nordic roots, employing 24,000 experts. Specializing in cloud, data, and software solutions, they serve enterprise and public-sector clients in over 90 countries. With an annual turnover of EUR 3 billion, Tietoevry is listed on NASDAQ in Helsinki, Stockholm, and Oslo Børs.* 




  





*Guided by openness, trust, and diversity, Tietoevry partners with clients to build digital futures where businesses, societies, and people thrive.* 




  





*Tietoevry Banking, the top financial software provider in the Nordics, offers modular solutions for core banking, payments, credit, and financial crime. They drive digital transformation and efficiency for financial institutions, while also combating financial crime.*

title: Audit Manager, Audit LC&I
company_industry: Financial Services and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
**Job Description**
*Do you see yourself leading audit projects in a vibrant environment? Would you like to work with experienced auditors across international locations at Danske Bank? And are you ready to elevate your career in an encouraging and growth-oriented setting?*
**Join our Audit LC&I Team**
 Danske Bank, a leader in the Nordic financial services industry, is seeking a highly experienced and resourceful Audit Manager to join our Audit LC&I team. This role is a great opportunity to contribute to the oversight and enhancement of the audit practice within an area critical to the bank’s operations - Large Corporates & Institutions
 **.** 
 You will be working in a team of experienced internal auditors, covering all LC&I locations and fund management companies with operations rooted in the Nordics yet having international presence in the US, UK, Lithuania, Poland and Ireland.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
 As an Audit Manager, some of your areas of responsibility will be to:
   

  

* Lead and manage audit projects within the Large Corporates & Institutions (LC&I) area, ensuring a comprehensive coverage of risks related to the LC&I financial services and product offerings. This also includes quality assuring the work of others.
* Evaluate the effectiveness of internal controls, risk management and governance processes relevant to LC&I and provide value adding insights on areas for improvement.
* Maintain stakeholder relationships with LC&I representatives, ensuring a collaborative and transparent dialogue around current and developing risks.
* Assist in the risk assessment of the LC&I business and give input to our audit response.
* Stay updated on regulatory developments and industry best practices to ensure that audit activities are effectively capturing high risk areas.


**Requirements:**
 The ideal candidate is expected to have:
   

  

* Bachelor of Science degree in Finance, Auditing, Business Administration or other related fields.
* Minimum 5 years of experience from an audit-, compliance- or risk function.
* Expertise relating to LC&I business activities, products and associated risks.
* Leadership and project management skills, capable of managing multiple projects simultaneously with meticulous attention to detail.
* Ëffective communication skills in English, both verbal and written, and the ability to seamlessly interact with all levels of management and staff.
* A solid knowledge of IT and data governance is beneficial.
* Knowledge of regulatory compliance and regulations relating to investor protection and market integrity, is also meriting.


**What We Offer:**
 As an employee in Group Internal Audit (GIA) you will have great opportunities for professional growth and career advancement, not only within our department of approx. 100 employees, but across Danske Bank as a whole. We are prioritizing creating an empowering yet supportive work environment, and to preserve our culture that encourages open-mindedness and promotes collaboration.
   

  

**Location:** 
 Copenhagen, Denmark/Stockholm, Sweden/Helsinki, Finland
   

  

**How to Apply:**
 Please submit your CV and motivational letter detailing your qualifications and why you believe your experience aligns with this role. We will commence first interviews once the application period has closed.
   

  

 For further inquiries about the position, please contact:
   

  

* Head of Audit LC&I Wilma Schön, wilma.schon@danskebank.se, or
* Head of Audit LC&I and Sustainability Morten Raskov, rasko@danskebank.dk.


**We look forward to receiving your application!**
**#DK #SE #FI**
**About Us**
 Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

title: Sr. Sales Account Executive
description:

 We're looking for a sales rockstar to drive strategic enterprise sales for Tungsten Automation Corporation's intelligent automation platform. You'll be orchestrating enterprise deals that make your colleagues jaws drop, helping major enterprises transform their business processes through our unique combination of RPA, cognitive capture, and analytics.
