title: Business Controller to ABB Process Control Platform
description:
**Business Controller to ABB Process Control Platform**
=======================================================

#### **At ABB, we are dedicated to addressing global challenges. Our core values: care, courage, curiosity, and collaboration - combined with a focus on diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities - are key drivers in our aim to empower everyone to create sustainable solutions. That's our story. Make it your story.**

### **Your role and responsibilities**


ABB's Process Automation team designs and implements automation solutions, from devices, to monitoring and control, enhancing our customers' return on investment. Our digitization solutions improve plant and enterprise productivity while reducing maintenance and energy costs. Our deep domain knowledge allows us to understand and address the challenges and opportunities of the market. This position is within the Process Control Platform (PCP) business unit. PCP serves as a value-generating partner, creating digital control solutions for various industries. We manage the entire value chain, from suppliers to delivery, ensuring competitive advantage through customer satisfaction, response time, cost, and on-time delivery. If you are interested in acting as a business partner to the organization, leading local controlling teams, optimizing financial performance, and supporting effective business decisions by analyzing and interpreting financial data to recommend the most appropriate solutions, then this job is for you! This role reports to the Senior Business Controller of the Business Unit. Your responsibilities: • Partner with the Business Unit Manager to define and determine business strategy aligned with wider Division and Product Group strategies • Convert business strategy into measurable targets and plans, assess financial implications, identify risks, and propose actions • Interface with other managers and Controllers about financial, market, organizational and customer situations • Oversee business planning and forecasting. • Serve as the interface to the wider organization for the business unit • Collaborate with the head of R&D on complete R&D controlling, including resource and cost monitoring and investment benefit analysis • Establish and oversee processes for transparent and reliable financial data. Ensure high standards of financial and master data and compliance with internal controls and regulations • With HR Manager support, ensure your area is organized, staffed, and guided. Develop direct/indirect subordinates within HR policies


### **Qualifications for the role**

* A Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a similar field
* 3+ years of experience in a Controlling role or a similar position
* Familiarity with computerized accounting systems (preferably SAP) and financial reporting software 1 | Business Controller
* An analytical mindset with attention to detail, accuracy, and multitasking abilities
* Flexible and pragmatic, able to express different views without conflict, with strong interpersonal skills Proactive, solution-oriented, team-focused sees opportunities in problems
* Fluency in English required, fluency or conversational skills in Swedish are considered a plus

### **More about us**


ABB is a leading global technology company that energizes the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future. The Process Automation (PA) business area (>$6B revenue in 2021, 22,000 employees), automates, electrifies and digitalizes some of the most complex industrial infrastructures on this planet. Through its five divisions, it serves customers in the energy, process and hybrid industries – from hydrocarbons, chemicals, water, mining, minerals, pulp & paper to marine and ports, and many more. PA stands at the heart of some of the most important shifts in society, helping the energy-intense industries to safer, smarter and more sustainable operations to enable a prosperous, low-carbon society. For more information on PA, refer to https://global.abb/group/en/investors/strategy-events/pa-capital-markets-day-2022 For further questions, please contact Recruiting Manager, Mohan Kumar, mohan-kumar.kg@in.abb.com. Union representatives - Sveriges Ingenjörer: Mikael Blomqvist, +46 768 06 00 11, Unionen: Krista Andersson, +46 706 44 02 85, Ledarna: Leif Öhrberg, +46 724 64 40 16. Talent Partner: Johannes Westermark Hester. We value people from different backgrounds. Could this be your story? Apply today or visit www.abb.com to read more about us and learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe. #MyABBStory Does this sound like the right role for you? Welcome to apply by March 2. We look forward to receiving your PDF application. If you want to discover more about ABB, take an-other look at our website www.abb.com. Please note that to be eligible for employment at ABB Sweden, you will need to pass our pre-employment screening steps. This includes a reference check, a drug test, and could also include an extended background check. We kindly decline direct contact with staffing and recruitment agencies as well as sellers of additional job advertisements.
company_description: ABB is a leading global technology company that energizes the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.

title: Future Talent - Analyst Salesforce
description:
*At Tetra Pak we commit to making food safe and available, everywhere; and we protect what's good – protecting food, protecting people, and protecting the planet. By doing so we touch millions of people's lives every day.*

*And we need people like you to make it happen.*


***We empower you to reach your potential with opportunities to make an impact to be proud of – for food, people and the planet.***

  


**Job Summary**
---------------



Start your career development and become Tetra Pak’s next Future Talent! We are looking for highly motivated newly graduates to join us in 2025!

  

  

Future Talent Programme is a Trainee Program within Tetra Pak. We offer a permanent position from start in September 2025 at our site in Lund. You will onboard an individually designed development program for 12 months connected to a specific position and the Tetra Pak organization. During the program you will participate in trainings and job rotations throughout various parts of Tetra Pak to explore your potential and grow as a person. As a Trainee here with us, you will get to know our entire business and collaborate with colleagues all over the world. And this is just the beginning of your Tetra Pak career!

  


Visit https://www.tetrapak.com/about-tetra-pak/careers/future-talent and read more about Tetra Pak Future Talent Program!

  


You will be based in Lund, Sweden but you will work in a global arena.


**What you will do**
--------------------



As our new Future Talent – Analyst Salesforce you will:


* You will be part of the Salesforce Delivery team that support Tetra Pak´s internal sales organisation and other stakeholders within Tetra Pak, as well as to some extent also our customers.
* We as a team maintain IT-solutions built on Salesforce platform.
* In this team of 20 plus persons you will work with projects and services on Salesforce platform.
* You will have colleagues in Lund in Sweden, Chakan in India and Texas in USA.
**We believe you have**
-----------------------


* You have a master’s degree in computer science, engineering or similar (Graduated 2024-2025)
* It is possible that you have experience working in software development
* You are fluent in English, written and spoken.
* You have good communications skills, written and spoken
* Previous international studies/experience are considered meritorious


**We Offer You**


* A variety of exciting challenges with ample opportunities for development and training in a truly global landscape
* A culture that pioneers a spirit of innovation where our industry experts drive visible results
* An equal opportunity employment experience that values diversity and inclusion
* Market competitive compensation and benefits with flexible working arrangements

  




**Apply Now**


If you are inspired to be part of our promise to protect what’s good; for food, people, and the planet, apply with your CV and Cover Letter in English through our careers page at https://jobs.tetrapak.com/.


This job posting expires on **2025-02-21.**  

Questions about your application contact Christina Höjerback at +46 46 36 3970  

To know more about the position contact Jeanette Winstrup at +46 46 36 3228  

To know more about the recruitment process contact Josephine Malalla at +46 46 36 5253  

For trade union information contact Unionen Lisbeth Larsson at +46 46 36 2320 and Sveriges Ingenjörer Lars Haraldsson at +46 46 36 2533

  


*Diversity, equity, and inclusion is an everyday part of how we work. We give people a place to belong and support to thrive, an environment where everyone can be comfortable being themselves and has equal opportunities to grow and succeed. We embrace difference, celebrate people for who they are, and for the diversity they bring that helps us better understand and connect with our customers and communities worldwide.*
company_description: At Tetra Pak we like a good challenge, and our promise is to make food safe and available everywhere.

title: Java utvecklare
description:
*Är du en erfaren Java utvecklare, tech lead eller arkitekt som vill jobba i framkant med Java och moderna molnlösningar? Vill du vara en nyckelspelare i spännande digitala transformationer? Då kan detta vara din nästa utmaning!
   

  

 Hos oss blir du en del av en stödjande och inkluderande gemenskap där vi värdesätter samarbete, kunskapsdelning och personlig utveckling. Vi tror på en miljö där du kan växa, känna dig trygg och inspireras av dina kollegor, samtidigt som du får möjlighet att arbeta med tekniska lösningar som gör verklig skillnad.*
**OM ROLLEN**
 Hos oss på Capgemini får du inte bara jobba med Java – du får forma framtiden. Vi ligger i framkant när det gäller Generative AI, Data Engineering och skalbara molnplattformar. Våra projekt ger dig möjlighet att utvecklas inom cutting-edge teknologier som Java, Spring, AWS, GCP, Azure, AliCloud, OpenShift, Kafka, GraphQL, React, Angular och Android.
   

  

 Oavsett om du vill axla rollen som tech lead, fördjupa dig i arkitektur eller bli specialist inom en viss teknologi, får du här alla verktyg för att lyckas. Vi arbetar med kunder i olika branscher, vilket betyder att du ständigt står inför stimulerande tekniska utmaningar. Hos oss är kunskap och utveckling i fokus – vi erbjuder certifieringar, utbildningar och mentorskap för att du alltid ska ligga steget före.
   

  

 På vårt Stockholmskontor trivs vi i rymliga, ljusa lokaler med daglig frukost, nybryggt kaffe och en fantastisk utsikt över kanalen vid Barnhusbron.
   

  

**DIN PROFIL**
* Minst 4 års erfarenhet av Java-utveckling
* Flytande kunskaper i svenska och engelska
* Erfarenhet av molnplattformar som AWS, GCP eller Azure är meriterande
* Kunskap inom Data Pipeline, Data Visualization eller Generative AI är ett stort plus


**VARFÖR DU KOMMER ATT TRIVAS HOS OSS**
* Konkurrenskraftig lön, förmånliga tjänstepensioner och kollektivavtal för trygghet
* Vi bryr oss om din hälsa och erbjuder initiativ för balans mellan arbete och fritid
* En kultur av samarbete och stödjande kollegor – här hjälper vi varandra
* Tillgång till Capgeminis massiva utbildningskatalog och bland annat expertkunskap inom generativ AI och data engineering
* En inkluderande arbetsplats där mångfald och innovation går hand i hand
* Sociala aktiviteter som afterworks, hackathons och sportaktiviteter
* Internationella karriärmöjligheter i ett globalt nätverk av 340,000 kollegor


**ANSÖKAN**
 Redo att starta ett nytt kapitel i karriären? Vi kan knappt vänta på att få höra från dig! Ansök redan idag – vi hanterar ansökningarna löpande. Under processen får du chansen att kika in på vårt kontor, prata med vår rekryterande chef och självklart ställa alla dina nyfikna frågor till vår rekryterare. Vi lovar att göra din resa mot jobbet så smidig och givande som möjligt. Är det dig vi letar efter? Vi ser fram emot att ses!
   

  

**OM CAPGEMINI**
 Capgemini är en global partner inom affärs- och tekniktransformation som hjälper organisationer att påskynda deras övergång till en digital och hållbar värld, och samtidigt gör skillnad för företag och samhälle. Det är en ansvarsfull och mångsidig organisation med 340 000 medarbetare i över 50 länder. Med ett starkt arv som sträcker sig över 55 år tillbaka har Capgemini sina kunders förtroende att hjälpa dem frigöra värdet av teknik för att tillgodose hela deras affärsbehov. Capgemini levererar helhetslösningar som utnyttjar styrkan från strategi och design till teknik. Allt drivet av en marknadsledande kapacitet inom AI, moln och data, kombinerat med en djup branschexpertis och ett ekosystem av partners. År 2023 rapporterade Capgemini Group globala intäkter på 22,5 miljarder euro.
   

  

 Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com

title: Firmware Engineer
description:
Join our client`s team and be part of a global project developing safer and more reliable energy solutions for cities worldwide. As a
 **Firmware Engineer** 
 , you’ll collaborate with colleagues across multiple countries, working on cutting-edge embedded systems and real-time applications.
 



  





  





 What You’ll Work On:
 



  





 Embedded Firmware Development – Low-level programming in C/C++ & Assembly
 



 Hardware & Low-Level Software – ARM, Coldfire, 68k, Sharc DSP, RTOS, Drivers, FPGA interfacing
 



 Communication Protocols – Ethernet, TCP/IP, DNP, IEC 61850, Modbus, I2C, SPI
 



 Real-Time Systems – Experience with RTOS, bare-metal firmware, and low-latency applications
 



 Hardware Debugging & Optimization – Hands-on experience with oscilloscopes, logic analyzers, and JTAG debugging
 



 Cybersecurity in Embedded Systems – Secure coding practices, encryption, and authentication for industrial applications
 



 Testing & Validation – Unit testing, HIL (Hardware-in-the-Loop), and automated testing for embedded software
 



 International Collaboration – Work with a distributed team, requiring strong English communication skills
 



  





  





 Nice-to-Have Skills:
 



  





 Linux Kernel Development & Driver Development
 



 Edge Computing & IoT Security
 



 Experience with Git, CI/CD for embedded systems

title: Game developer
description:
*Please note - this is an in-house role in our Stockholm office. Remote candidates will not be considered. Unfortunately we cannot help with relocation from other countries or VISA applications.*
 Hacksaw Studios is a company that builds online games. We have wide distribution and our games are played by millions of people every month by players all over the world.
   

  

 We are currently looking to expand our development team with 2-3 additional developers and are looking for both junior and senior candidates. You will be part of our game development team and work in a tight knit team involving both front-end developers and designers. Your task will be to bring our game ideas to life in co-operation with the designers and product owners.
   

  

 We offer a nice office in central Stockholm, an opportunity to work with other experienced game developers as well as a co-ownership program for suitable candidates.
   

  

**Your Tasks Will Include**
* Work with the development and design team to create new games and update old games, as required
* Maintain and implement new features into our game development framework
* Learn about the online gaming industry and stay up to date on current trends and what is popular with players
* Participate in code reviews and merge requests
* Work on our game development framework which modularizes functionality that gets re-used between games
* Co-operate with colleagues with similar roles, both in-house and with our partners


**Required Skills And Experience**
* Experience with game development, or a solid development background and a strong desire to learn
* Experience with a programming language suited for game development, such as Javascript, Typescript, C#, Haxe or similar


 Other things that would be a bonus (but not required):
   

  

* Experience with some form of game development library, such as Unity, Unreal Engine, Pixi or similar
* Shader programming experience
* 3d programming experience, such as OpenGL
* A working knowledge of how a browser communicates with a back-end server
* Experience in debugging
* Social gaming experience
* A personal interest in games and an understanding of the industry, or a desire to learn


 To apply for this role, please submit your CV at https://hacksawstudios.bamboohr.com/jobs

title: Backendutvecklare (C#)
description:
**Arbeta i ett nyfiket och dedikerat team i nära samarbete med våra användare på finansavdelningen och bygg system som gör det enkelt för dem att göra sitt jobb!**
**Om tjänsten**
 Vi söker en backendutvecklare inom C# till vårt IT Finansteam. Teamen ansvarar för hela kedjan från kravförståelse, utveckling, deploy till förvaltning och support. Vi jobbar agilt med continuous delivery. Det viktigaste för oss är inte bara vilka tekniker du kan idag utan det allra viktigaste är din inställning, nyfikenhet och viljan att lära nytt och bidra till vår vidareutveckling och kultur. I teamet arbetar vi övervägande med mobbprogrammering och nära verksamheten med snabba feedbackloopar för ständig förbättring.
   

  

 Vi är 13 utvecklingsteam på vår IT-avdelning och vi utvecklar våra system i Microsoft miljö med moderna tekniker, ramverk och verktyg såsom .NET Core, C#, Azure, React, JavaScript, Node, MS-SQL, Visual Studio, etc.
   

  

****Vem vi söker****
**Vi önskar att du uppfyller följande punkter:**
* Erfarenhet av ha jobbat som systemutvecklare inom C#.Net, Visual Studio och MS-SQL
* Relevant yrkeshögskole- eller universitetsutbildning
* Flytande svenska i tal och skrift


**Det är meriterande om du även kan:**
* Erfarenhet av molnbaserade tjänster (gärna Azure)
* React, Typescript
* DevOps
* Erfarenhet av finansiell data och system (bokföring, fakturering, kontohantering etc.)


 Vi söker dig som är en teamspelare som värdesätter samarbete och aktivt bidrar till teamets framgång. Vi ser att du trivs med att arbeta i grupp och är bekväm med att ägna en stor del av tiden åt mobbprogrammering och gemensamt problemlösande.
   

  

****Vi erbjuder****
 Vi erbjuder en spännande och utvecklande miljö där du får möjlighet till en intern karriär. Du får en omväxlande vardag tillsammans med härliga kollegor - vi arbetar i nära samarbete mellan de nordiska länderna för att ge våra gäster de bästa veckorna på året. Vi har bra reseförmåner och dessutom ett högt medarbetarengagemang som år efter år visar sig i vår interna medarbetarundersökning. Vi älskar vårt jobb och välkomnar dig ombord på vår resa i Nordic Leisure Travel Group!
   

  

****Övrigt****
 Tjänsten är en heltidstjänst och placerad på Vings huvudkontor på Kungsholmen i Stockholm. Det är möjligt med distansarbete upp till 2 dagar per vecka när arbetet tillåter. Arbetsspråk är svenska. Intervjuer kommer ske löpande så skicka din ansökan idag!
   

  

 Har du frågor kring tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Susanne Almqvist på susanne.almqvist@nltg.com eller på telefon 070-951 34 32.
   

  

**I denna rekrytering använder vi oss av tester från Alva Labs – ett logiskt problemlösningstest och ett personlighetstest. Testerna utgår från vedertagen forskning och ger oss möjlighet att på ett opartiskt sätt bedöma dina styrkor och eventuella utmaningar i relation till aktuell tjänst. Under rekryteringsprocessen kommer du att få testerna skickade till dig med mer information, är du nyfiken redan nu kan du läsa mer om dem hos** 
**Alva Labs** 
**.**
 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

**🏄‍♂️ Kul på jobbet**
**🤝 Tjänstepension**
**🌎 Reseförmåner**
**🦉 Utveckling och lärande**
**💗 Well-being**
**💼 Hybrid arbetsplats**
 Läs mer om vad vi erbjuder här
   

  

 Ving ingår i den nordiska resekoncernenNordic Leisure Travel Group.
   

  

 I gruppen ingår researrangörerna Ving Sverige, Ving Norge, Globetrotter, Spies i Danmark, Tjäreborg i Finland, flygbolaget Sunclass Airlines samt våra egna hotellkoncept Sunwing Family Resorts, Ocean Beach Club och Sunprime Hotels. Gruppen säljer ett normalt år runt 1 500 000 resor i de nordiska länderna.
   

  

 Arbetsområde
   

  

 IT
   

  

 Roll: Development
   

  

 Platser: Stockholm
   

  

 Remote status
   

  

 Hybridarbete
   

  

 Anställningsform: Heltid
   

  

 Sista ansökningsdag: 7 mars 2025
   

  

 Kontaktperson: Susanne Almqvist

title: Backend Engineer (Cross Markets CO/RG Team)
description:
**Description**
*Position at LeoVegas Group*
**About The Role**
 CORGi - Common Customer Onboarding and Responsible Gaming team - is looking for seasoned developer which will support us in delivering a smooth, fun and healthy experience for our players. As a cross functional team we’re working with a number of different stakeholders - market owners, operations and architects.
   

  

 Your main focus will be development of existing tools and services utilized by market and AML teams. Our infrastructure is event-driven and cloud-based with 230+ services, spanning across several production environments. We work in a semi-remote (more than half of the team is based in Stockholm) team of five engineers backed up by a product manager, a product owner and an engineering manager.
   

  

 YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:
   

  

* Developing and improving microservices used by several markets.
* Refining requirements with your technical expertise in our domain.
* Taking part in designing solutions by providing your input in discussions with architects, product managers and other stakeholders.
* Supporting the existing ecosystem by building or using existing monitors.
* Maintaining high quality of the code via PRs, writing tests and documentation.


 OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE THE FOLLOWING:
   

  

**Essential Skills**
* Have at least 4+ years of experience as a Java backend developer.
* Be familiar with distributed software architecture - microservices (we use Spring Boot) and message queues (ideally Kafka).
* Know SQL databases (we use MySQL).
* Have worked before with cloud platforms (we use GCP).


 NICE TO HAVES
   

  

* Proficiency with Kotlin.


**Who We Are**
 At the core of LeoVegas Group is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. We’re a team of over 1800 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 16 offices worldwide.
   

  

**Benefits**
* Hybrid work policy
* 4 weeks of Workation (T&C apply)
* 30 annual vacation days
* Occupational Pension
* 5,000 SEK wellness contribution annually
* Parental Leave Top-Up
* Possibility to enroll in a private health care insurance for both you and your partner
* 1,500 SEK equipment allowance
* Benify - benefits portal with many offers and discounts
* We offer a relocation package with accommodation and flights.


 JOIN US!
   

  

 In our pride, we empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don’t wait for things to happen; we pounce and make it happen!

title: Business Applications Developer
description:
**You will be a part of…** 




 ...an international environment with colleagues all around Europe with our headquarters in Stockholm, Sweden. You will join a fast and innovative environment and be a part of a great-positioned company, with even higher ambitions for the future. Scrive is filled with caring, smart and committed people who know that we need to collaborate to win. We care about each other and encourage ourselves and each other in our aim to be better and grow, both as people and as a company. Come join us and be a part of Scrive’s successful journey!
 *🚀* 




  





 We are looking for a Business Applications Developer to our Revenue Operations team. You will be part of a team with two others reporting directly to our Head of Revenue Operations. This is a cross-functional role, where you will collaborate with other departments such as Finance, Data, and Revenue. You’ll work closely with both Operations Specialists and our Salesforce Administrator.
 



  





 You can either be located at our Stockholm Office and work in a hybrid setup (both office and from home), or totally remote if you are located elsewhere.
 



  





**Your challenge** 




 As a Business Applications Developer, you will be responsible for managing and maintaining our billing processes, ensuring seamless integration between Salesforce, PE Accounting and the backend of our product. You will own, manage and continuously develop two key middlewares that are in place to automate our billing and related processes. You will work proactively with improvements and testing to ensure a smooth billing process, a critical part of generating our positive cash flow.
 



  





 In your everyday work, your responsibilities will include:
 


* **Middleware Management:** 
 Own, manage and continue to develop the integration middlewares between Salesforce, PE, and our product backend to fetch usage data and ensure accurate billing.
* **Billing Processes** 
 : Oversee billing processes, ensuring timely and accurate invoicing, reconciliation, and reporting.
* **Salesforce Development** 
 : Own Salesforce development and handle development and administration tasks related to Salesforce. Mostly on Revenue Cloud (CPQ + Billing modules).
* **Solution Architecture:** 
 Own architectural design of business applications - including middlewares, integrations, and Salesforce code base. Ensuring scalability, performance, and security across our application landscape.
* **Custom Integration:** 
 Build the odd custom system integration for when the standard integration doesn’t cut it and ensure data accuracy and consistency.
* **Problem Resolution:** 
 Identify and resolve any issues related to billing, integrations, and system performance.
* **Documentation:** 
 Maintain detailed documentation of billing processes, system configurations, and integration workflows.



  





**Who we think you are** 




 We believe you are a constant improver, able to effortlessly build relationships with anyone at any time. To succeed in this role, you will need:
 


* Minimum 2 years of experience in developing system integrations/middlewares
* Proficiency in at least a few of the following programming languages - JavaScript, Java, C#, SQL, and/or Python is required
* Meticulous attention to detail and accuracy in managing billing processes and system integrations
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams



  





**🌟 Also, big bonus points if you have:** 



* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Finance, or a related field is preferred
* Familiarity with ERPs/Accounting systems, billing processes, and preferably accounting, such as having built these kinds of integrations and/or middlewares before is highly desirable
* Experience with Salesforce development (APEX) and administration is highly beneficial but not required



  





 Don’t meet every single requirement? Apply anyway! Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. We want to build a diverse and inclusive workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we still want to hear from you.
 



  





 In this role we see that you are
 **problem solving** 
 ,
 **structured** 
 ,
 **flexible** 
 and
 **taking initiatives** 
 . We’re using a competence-based recruitment process where those competences will play an important role.

title: Defect Manager
company: DevsData Tech Talent LLC - IT Recruitment
description:
**Defect Test Manager** 




  





**💰Up to $41 per hour** 




**🌎** 
**Stockholm, Sweden (On-Site/hybrid)** 





 ☑️
 
**Full-time, long-term** 




**🕦 B2B contract** 




  






 Are you a detail-oriented professional with a strong understanding of defect management and a passion for retail technology? 
 





 We are looking for an exceptional Test Manager (here referred to as a Defect Manager) based in Stockholm, Sweden to spearhead the defect management process across multiple testing phases of a global retail solution program. In this role, you will collaborate closely with the other Test Manager, Test Team, international Vendors, and Workstream Leads to ensure a seamless and effective testing experience. The product solution includes the integration of payment, point of sale, back-office, and edge computing technologies. The European Defect Manager will work with the European Test Manager to ensure alignment with the Global test strategy and must be an effective leader, communicator and problem solver.  
 




  





**Requirements:** 



* Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field and/or relevant work experience
* Ideally 5+ years as a Test Manager or Senior Tester or related work experience
* Deep understanding of IT testing principles/best practices
* Strong knowledge of the Atlassian tool set – Jira, Confluence
* Expert ability to create Jira reports, filters and dashboards
* Experience on defining and implementing defect/test management strategies, including defining severity and priority levels
* Experience working with 3rd Party Onshore & Offshore development partners
* Knowledge of SDLC, and testing standards and methods
* Strong knowledge of the MS Office Suite – Project, Visio, Word, Excel
* Industry Certification a plus – ITIL, ISTQB
* Outstanding written and verbal communication skills in English



  





**Responsibilities:** 



* Own and manage the defect/test management process, securing the relevant approvals throughout each test phase
* Facilitate defect review meetings, perform defect administration via Jira and Confluence, and track defect resolution from start to finish in the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC)
* Coordinate with internal leadership, and third-party vendor teams to achieve timely and efficient closure of defects
* Triage defects, assign to the appropriate action owner and accelerate progress
* Ensure all defects are entered correctly in Jira and controlled/managed as effectively as possible through their lifecycle
* Maintain integrity of the defect database and build dashboards within Jira and ensuring a full audit trail for any changes made to defect status outside of the published defect process
* Work closely with the test team to ensure defects are entered correctly into the system and for re-test cycles to be performed
* Work closely with the release team to ensure vendors provide fixes for defects in the upcoming releases
* Perform defect tracking, monitoring and report on defect status and vendor performance to the program, including any ad hoc report requests



  





**Get to know DevsData** 





 We are a technology consulting and IT recruitment agency, delivering software solutions to clients from Europe and the US. We work 100% remotely, in an international team. We employ people with experience in international corporations as well as the ones from the best technical and business universities.
 





 Find out more:
 
 https://devsdata.com

title: Security Infrastructure Engineer
description:
**Do you want to be at the forefront of protecting our society against cyber threats? We are looking for a Security Infrastructure Engineer to team up with the most dedicated team of cyber specialists in our Secure Infrastructure domain.**
**About Truesec – A Leading Cybersecurity Company**
 Since 2005, Truesec has been a native cybersecurity company, driven by one single purpose: Creating safety and sustainability in a digital world by preventing cyber breach and minimizing impact.
   

  

 Over the years, we’ve earned the trust of organizations worldwide and gained a strong reputation internationally. Our team consists of dedicated specialists covering the entire spectrum of cybersecurity – with capabilities in Predict, Prevent, Protect, Respond, and Recover.
   

  

 Today, we employ around 350 employees – and as cybercrime grows, we need to grow. To support that goal, we are now looking for a Security Infrastructure Engineer who wants to create advanced security solutions in our Secure Infrastructure Domain.
   

  

**Secure Infrastructure**
 Looking at the actual threat landscape today, it’s more important than ever to design and build infrastructure solutions that incorporate correct and relevant security features. The team works closely together using their combined knowledge and experience gathered from different projects and Incident Response cases to help our customers stay ahead of the threat actors. We continuously help customers improve their security posture within cloud, data center, endpoint management, identity, M365, and networking.
   

  

**The Role**
 The Security engineer interfaces regularly with team members and customers, determine technical requirements, feasibility of projects and expectations. You are responsible for maintaining, implementing, and designing client-facing solutions primarily in Active Directory, Entra ID, Azure and Microsoft 365 Security Solutions. This role is for someone who wants to be hands-on in a Microsoft infrastructure role leaning towards cloud but with the experience and knowledge of On-premises/hybrid environments. You must be able to think on your feet and you’ve got to want to learn and be part of a highly skilled and innovative team.
   

  

 Other responsibilities you might have can be:
   

  

* Run health and security checks on Active Directory, Microsoft 365 including Entra ID.
* Assisting our Customers with Tiering Projects.
* Provide customers with design and also assist with the actual implementation.
* Implement solutions based on Statement of Work with customers.


**Your Potential Background**
 We believe that your background probably entails 7+ years of experience and expertise within Microsoft solutions for both Cloud and On-premise/hybrid environments. You feel comfortable with guiding stakeholders towards a more secure and robust environment by giving technical recommendations that can persist the current threats present today.
   

  

 You are comfortable with guiding customers within areas such as: AD-Security, Entra ID-security, Windows Server Hardening, Azure security.
   

  

**Required Skills:**
* Active Directory Security
* Windows server Security
* Azure Security
* Microsoft 365 Security
* Overall a strong Cybersecurity competence within Microsoft Infrastructure.


**Bonus Skills:**
* Knowledge of scripting languages such as PowerShell and/or Python
* Cloud migration journeys from On-prem to Azure.
* Experience with Azure networking: Express Route, Virtual Network & Load Balancers
* Hypervisor knowledge of Hyper-V, VMware.
* Experience working with monitoring and logging tools (e.g.: Log Analytics, Azure Monitor, Azure Sentinel, ELK/ElasticSearch/Kibana)
* Experience with other cloud providers such as AWS and GCP.


*Due to the sensitivity in our assignments, we require Swedish/Danish citizenship, citizenship in an EU country, or a Swedish/Danish work permit.*
**Join Our Mission Toward a Safe Digital Future**
 If you truly want to make a difference and make our world a little bit safer, this is the place for you. At Truesec, you'll get to be at the forefront of fighting cybercrime instead of reading about it in the news. This is your chance to be part of an exciting journey in a leading cybersecurity company - and learn from some of the best in their field.
   

  

 So, are you ready to team up with the most dedicated team of experts and be part of a meaningful mission? Then we are excited to get to know you!

title: Expert Site Reliability Engineer in Technology Excellence and Innovation (Expert IT Developer)
description:
**Job ID:
 ******28525********
 We are looking for an Expert Site Reliability Engineer to play a pivotal role in implementing best practices for availability, reliability and scalability of our applications in Nordea.
   

  

**About Our Team**
 Meet the Application Maintenance Team within Technology Excellence and Innovation. Our mission is to “lead Technology to higher levels of productivity, advancing the experience we provide to our customers by enabling innovation and expanding the impact of our Technologists.
   

  

 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in how we work and how we make decisions – and that we imagine you share with us.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
 As an Expert Site Reliability Engineer you’ll play a valuable role by delivering the Customer Reliability Engineering (CRE) training programme to build SREs of the future and work on initiatives to implement AI Ops and predictive application maintenance in Nordea.
   

  

**Main responsibilities in this role:**
* Lead and improve the Customer Reliability Engineer programme; organize and facilitate the three program levels (Foundation, Practitioner and Expert), guide participants with impediments, cooperate with Group Learning and IT Groups
* Mentor and coach the Application Maintenance capability to foster a culture of agility and continuous improvement
* Proactively research and identify emerging technologies, tools and methodologies with the potential to transform delivery of application maintenance. Stay up to date on the latest advancements and share insights with execution leaders about best practices, lessons learned, and valuable resources
* Foster a culture of collaboration and knowledge sharing across teams, service areas and domains. Facilitate workshops, forums, community of practices and cross-functional initiatives to promote idea exchange, best practice sharing, and cross-pollination of innovative ideas


**Who You Are**
 This is the right role for you if you would like to take an active role in uplifting how we ensure stability and reliability of our applications in Nordea.
   

  

**Your background and skills include:**
* Expert knowledge in monitoring, observability, scripting and automation
* Strong knowledge of Service Reliability Engineering and best practices in Application Maintenance
* Experience of DevOps
* Experience of software development
* Hands on knowledge of databases, networks, system administration
* Excellent English skills, both spoken and written


**It would be ideal if you also:**
* Demonstrate ability to build and maintain meaningful professional networks
* Have a trong communication skills to teach and convey messages in a professional manner
* Have a technology related degree and 5+ years’ experience as an Site Reliability Engineer, DevOps Engineer, or Application Maintenance/Operations technical expert preferred


**What We Offer**
 People come here when they want to get somewhere. For some, it’s to take their career to the next level. For others, it’s to break new ground within their area of expertise – in other words, with us, you will always move forward.
   

  

 A culture that fosters performance and growth in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.
   

  

 Hybrid working model – we believe in the value of bringing people together and at the same time we embrace the freedom of flexibility.
   

  

 Diversity and inclusion are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving.
   

  

 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
   

  

**Next steps**
 Submit your application no later than 20/02/2025.
   

  

**The recruitment process consists of the following steps:**
* Preliminary CV selection
* Phone conversation with the recruiter
* Online interview with the hiring leader
* Background check


 We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good.
   

  

**We build relationships** 
 . We add a personal touch to everything we do – when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues, and meeting our potential candidates.
   

  

**We learn and develop.** 
 We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customers’ needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on a broader perspective in our daily challenges.
   

  

**We lead change** 
 . We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy.
   

  

**We are Nordea** 
 . We have a 200-year history of supporting and growing the Nordic economies and our values are deeply rooted in these open, progressive and collaborative societies. As one of the biggest employers in the Nordics, Poland and Estonia, you have excellent opportunities to evolve, develop and move forward with us.
   

  

**For candidates in Finland:** 
 A security clearance will be performed for the person selected for this position.
   

  

**For candidates in Sweden:** 
 For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.
   

  

**For candidates in Poland:** 
 Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following:
   

  

 In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‘GDPR’. I agree to have: my personal data, education and employment history proceeded for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp.
   

  

 The administrator of your personal data is: Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address: Aleja Edwarda Rydza Śmiglego 20, 93-281 Łodź. Your personal data will be processed for the recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. You have a right to access your personal data, right to rectify and right to delete. Disclosing the personal data in the scope specified by the provisions of Polish Labour Code from 26 June 1974 and executive acts are mandatory. Providing personal data is necessary to conduct the recruitment processes. The request for the deletion of your personal data means resignation from further participation in recruitment processes and causes the immediate removal of your application. Detailed information concerning processing of your personal data can be found at: nordea.com/en/doc/nordea-privacy-policy-for-applicants.pdf.
   

  

 We reserve the right to reply only to selected applications.

title: Salesforce Engineer
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open-source software and operating systems for global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in more than 80 countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder led, profitable and growing.
   

  

 We are hiring a
 **Business Systems Engineer** 
 with Salesforce experience, who strives for the highest engineering quality and process efficiency, seeks improvements, continuously develops their skills, and applies them at work. This is an exciting opportunity to work with several popular business systems, and deliver first-class experience to Canonical business operations.
   

  

 The Commercial Systems unit has several areas of responsibility spread across five engineering teams, closely collaborating with other engineering and business teams at Canonical. The
 **Business Systems** 
 team is responsible for systems such as NetSuite, Salesforce, and several others. The engineers work closely with operations teams, implement business processes, and keep the systems compliant. This team is a great opportunity for an individual with a genuine interest in understanding the business, high engineering standards, and drive to deliver first-class experience to Canonical employees using those systems to get their job done.
   

  

**Location** 
 : This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.
   

  

**The role entails**
* Develop engineering solutions in NetSuite, Salesforce, and other business systems
* Collaborate with colleagues on business specifications, technical designs, and code reviews
* Learn Canonical business processes
* Depending on your seniority, coach, mentor, and offer career development feedback
* Develop and evangelize great engineering and organizational practices


**What we are looking for in you**
* Exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
* Undergraduate degree in a technical subject or a compelling narrative about your alternative chosen path
* Track record of going above-and-beyond expectations to achieve outstanding results
* Experience with NetSuite, Salesforce, or other CRM/ERP systems
* Professional written and spoken English with excellent presentation skills
* Result-oriented, with a personal drive to meet commitments
* Ability to travel internationally twice a year, for company events up to two weeks long


**Nice-to-have skills**
* Performance engineering and security experience
* Experience with accounting, sales, sales operations, or other business roles


 What we offer colleagues
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Program
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Data Governance Engineer
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open-source software and operating systems for global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in more than 80 countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder led, profitable and growing.
   

  

 We are hiring a
 **Data Governance Engineer** 
 with focus on data governance policies, processes, standards, and monitoring in compliance with internal policies and applicable regulatory frameworks, e.g., GDPR, DPA, ISO, etc. A successful candidate will develop and maintain an internal data catalog with automated data labeling and quality metrics, perform access management and ensure data security best practices.
   

  

 The Data Governance team in the Commercial Systems unit has a mission to enable a secure and well-governed access to comprehensive data sets originating at many internal and external data sources formed in a data mesh. The team works with well-known open-source data governance tools such as Trino and Ranger, defines and executes data governance processes, and democratizes the data at Canonical.
   

  

**Location** 
 : This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.
   

  

**The role entails**
* Define, monitor, and execute data governance policies
* Design, implement, and maintain data labeling and quality metrics in the data catalog
* Deploy and operate services developed by the team
* Depending on your seniority, coach, mentor, and offer career development feedback
* Develop and evangelize great engineering and organizational practices


**What we are looking for in you**
* Exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
* Undergraduate degree in a technical subject or a compelling narrative about your alternative chosen path
* Track record of going above-and-beyond expectations to achieve outstanding results
* Experience with data quality, governance, and security processes and tools
* Experience with software development in Python and SQL
* Professional written and spoken English with excellent presentation skills
* Result-oriented, with a personal drive to meet commitments
* Ability to travel internationally twice a year, for company events up to two weeks long

* Performance engineering and security experience
